text: An intelligent system connected to the video surveillance in the terminal can be given parameters to search for the current or latest location of a vehicle or person in the terminal by being given the register plate, a photo of a person, or other such identifying data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Surveillance System for Current or Latest Location Identification

**Description**: As a developer, I want the intelligent surveillance system to be developed with built-in mechanisms to protect the privacy of individuals whose data, such as vehicle registration plates or photos, are being used for current or latest location identification in the terminal. Additionally, I want the system to provide clear explanations and documentation about how personal data is being used, processed, and stored, ensuring transparency for users and stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Terminal area and booking documents and booking app contains the help information (for different purposes broken down).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Comprehensive Help Information for Terminal Area, Booking Documents, and Booking App

**Description**: As a user, I need access to clear and comprehensive help information for the terminal area, booking documents, and booking app, so that I can understand how to effectively use these services and make informed decisions without confusion. This help information should be broken down by different purposes to cater to various user needs.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Beneficence

text: Before a person with a vehicle enters the port, they are given explanation of what information will be handled, for example at the stage of making a reservation when they agree to give the necessary information of their vehicle.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Informed Consent for Vehicle Information Handling

**Description**: Before a person with a vehicle enters the port, they should receive a clear explanation of what information will be handled. This information should be provided at the stage of making a reservation, ensuring that individuals are fully informed and can voluntarily agree to provide the necessary details about their vehicle.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: A clear advertisement is placed on the booking document about the AI and data privacy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inform Users About AI Usage and Data Privacy on Booking Documents

**Description**: As a user, I want to see a clear advertisement on the booking document that explains how AI is utilized and provides information about data privacy, so that I can understand how my data is being used and feel secure in my privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: Data information policy is communicated at the service app/web page. Procedures in place for GDPR compliance and required steps are planned for example huge amount of user data request. For example redirection of resources or waiting times are clearly communicated.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear Communication of Data Policies and GDPR Compliance

**Description**: As a user, I want the service app/web page to clearly communicate its data information policy, including procedures in place for GDPR compliance. This will include steps planned for managing large volumes of user data requests, such as resource redirection or expected waiting times, so that I can understand how my personal data is handled and my privacy is safeguarded.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: No feature of the smart terminal or port must interfere in an unwanted way with any system in the passenger vehicles.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Unwanted Interference with Passenger Vehicle Systems

**Description**: As a smart terminal or port user, I want to ensure that no feature of the smart terminal or port interferes in an unwanted way with any system in the passenger vehicles, so that passengers' safety, dignity, and vehicle functionality are safeguarded.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Dignity

text: Car indentation system (digital, semi-automated, etc.) with control, navigation and markings is placed in the car deck to direct cars in line and to right places.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Car Indentation System for Organized Parking 

**Description**: As a car deck designer, I want to implement a car indentation system with digital, semi-automated control, navigation, and markings that directs cars to line up and park in designated spots. This system aims to improve parking efficiency and safety through clear guidance while ensuring users are informed about how the system functions, thereby making the parking process beneficial and transparent.

**Ethical principles used**: Beneficence, Transparency

text: The system has a reliable way to detect people sitting in a vehicle, that is in balance with respecting the privacy of passengers and adhering to border protocols
ethical_us:
**Title**: Reliable and Privacy-Respectful Passenger Detection in Vehicles

**Description**: As a user of the border control system, I want a reliable method to detect people sitting in a vehicle that ensures the privacy of passengers, so that border protocols are adhered to without compromising individuals' personal data and maintaining the trust of all stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Trust

text: The system is transparent in its functioning and marks possible "uncertain" situations with timestamps or other identifying information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Transparency and Equity with Timestamped Annotations on Uncertainties

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently indicate uncertain situations by marking them with timestamps or other identifying information so that I can understand and verify the context and validity of the outputs, ensuring fair treatment and results.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Justice and Fairness

text: Car identification system is tested with right and wrong data and error handling is defined in the terminal action plan and terminal personnel is trained with error handling.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Comprehensive Testing and Training for Car Identification System

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that the car identification system is thoroughly tested with both correct and incorrect data, and that error handling procedures are clearly defined and incorporated into the terminal action plan. Additionally, terminal personnel must be properly trained in these error handling procedures to ensure effective and trustworthy operations.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: The data tied to a person can be found and is eraseable in the system upon request.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Right to Data Erasure on Request

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to request the deletion of my personal data from the system and have assurance that the data tied to me can be found and erased promptly upon my request.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Smart terminal area is defined in the blueprints of the SMARTER project with responsibilities and roles.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Define Smart Terminal Area Roles and Responsibilities

**Description**: As a member of the SMARTER project team, I want the smart terminal area defined in the blueprints to include clear responsibilities and roles, ensuring that all stakeholders are accountable for their actions and that privacy protocols are established and maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Privacy

text: The data storing and collecting follows the GDPR regulations and identifying data is anonymized or destroyed within the legal time frame.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure GDPR-Compliant Data Handling

**Description**: As a responsible data custodian, I want to ensure that all data storing and collecting processes strictly follow GDPR regulations, so that any identifying data is anonymized or destroyed within the legal time frame. This will protect user privacy and uphold our ethical responsibility towards data management.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Responsibility

text: Before being able to finish purchasing tickets, the passenger is required to accept the terms and conditions of using the smart terminal and having the minimum required data collected.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Informed Consent for Data Collection and Usage

**Description**: As a passenger, I want to be fully informed and give explicit consent before purchasing tickets, so that I understand the terms and conditions of using the smart terminal and am aware of the specific data being collected, ensuring my freedom and autonomy are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: Communication plan has a section about on-time communication for different logistical purposes towards car carriers
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure On-time Communication for Car Carriers

**Description**: A communication plan must include specific sections that ensure the timely dissemination of information for various logistical purposes related to car carriers. This fosters transparency in the communication process and builds trust among all stakeholders by ensuring that relevant information is shared promptly and accurately.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Data consent lifecycle is defined in the SMART terminal blueprints.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Define Data Consent Lifecycle in SMART Terminal Blueprints

**Description**: As a user, I want the SMART terminal blueprints to include a clearly defined data consent lifecycle, so that I am fully informed about how my personal data will be collected, used, stored, and deleted, and can provide informed consent. This ensures that my privacy is respected and provides transparency regarding data handling processes.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Harbor area will have clear signs of the data requirities and visualize the flow of events.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Data Requirement Signage and Event Flow Visualization

**Description**: As a user, I want the harbor area to have clear signage explaining the data requirements and visualizations of the flow of events, so that I can understand what data is being collected, why it is collected, and how it is being used. This will allow me to make informed decisions regarding my data privacy while ensuring transparency in data handling processes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The boarding process is as similar to what it used to be as possible, or even simpler. Any and all instructions are crystal clear so that the passengers are able to proceed without asking for assistance as often as possible.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear, Autonomy-Promoting Boarding Process

**Description**: As a boarding system designer, I want to ensure that the boarding process is as similar to the traditional one as possible, or even simpler. Clear and concise instructions should be provided so that passengers can proceed without frequently asking for assistance, promoting their autonomy and confidence in the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: Action plan for personnels in terms of delays are embedded into the logistics plan and it will have a section on human behaviour with smart system delays and actions preventing misbehaviour on passsengers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement Action Plan for Delays in Logistics with Ethical Consideration for Human Behavior

**Description**: As a logistics planner, I want to embed an action plan for personnel regarding delays into the overall logistics plan. This plan should include a dedicated section on human behavior, which leverages a smart system to predict delays and suggest actions to prevent passenger misbehavior. The goal is to ensure a smooth, efficient, and ethical handling of delays, thereby benefitting both the staff and the passengers.

**Ethical principles used**: Beneficence, Responsibility

text: The system can display capacity information for passengers that access the service remotely and at the port, display terminals can also provide these types of information for passengers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Capacity Information Transparently and Reliably for Passengers

**Description**: As a passenger, I want the system to display clear and accurate capacity information both remotely and at the port's display terminals, so that I can trust the information provided and make informed decisions about my travel plans.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Clear logs that shows the state of the system and provide appropriate feedback and APIs that can improve system integration.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Logging and Feedback for Improved System Integration

**Description**: As a user, I want clear logs that display the state of the system and APIs that provide appropriate feedback, to ensure seamless system integration and build trust through transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Technical data of the camera is communicated to developers and also to wider audience in order to built trust on the system as a whole
ethical_us:
**Title**: Communicate Technical Camera Data Transparently

**Description**: As a developer, I want technical data of the camera to be communicated not only to the developing team but also to a wider audience. This will help build trust in the system by ensuring that the functionality and limitations of the camera are openly shared and understood by all stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Transparency

text: Different use cases in passenger flows are modeled and communicated to all needed participants torugh the development lifecycle.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Communication of Passenger Flow Use Cases 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that different use cases in passenger flows are transparently modeled and communicated to all relevant participants throughout the development lifecycle, so that everyone involved has a clear understanding of the processes, potential risks, and responsibilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: Passengers are instructed to clear their register plates before arriving to the terminal. An employee is still present to resolve problem situations (e.g. to quickly clean the register plate if needed). Accidents are handled as they currently are when two human drivers are involved. For accident situations with smart vehicles, accountability is also determined by the smart vehicle's accountability.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Safe and Responsible Use of Smart Vehicles at Terminals

**Description**: As a smart vehicle system, I want to ensure that passengers are instructed to clear their register plates before arriving at the terminal, and that an employee is present to resolve any problem situations, such as quickly cleaning the register plate if needed, so as to minimize the risk of accidents. In case of accidents involving smart vehicles, accountability will be determined according to existing practices used for human drivers, supplemented by the smart vehicle's accountability to ensure clear responsibilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: If the terminal interacts with smart vehicles, it must be in a way that does not compromise the safety of either party. There must be clear limits to what data is shared and what permissions the systems have for information exchange.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure and Safe Interaction with Smart Vehicles

**Description**: As a user of the terminal, I want the interaction with smart vehicles to be conducted in a way that ensures the safety of both parties is not compromised. Additionally, there should be clear restrictions on what data is shared and the permissions granted for information exchange to protect privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Non-maleficence

text: Smart harborfollows a protocol on traditional cars and a smart vehicles when developing the flow of events from harbor entering to entering to the ship.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fairness and Transparency in Harbor Vehicle Protocols

**Description**: As a requirements engineer, I want Smart Harbor to develop a standardized and transparent protocol for both traditional cars and smart vehicles when managing the flow of events from harbor entry to ship entry to ensure fairness and equitable treatment regardless of the type of vehicle.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Transparency

text: Boarding pass on cars are shared with instructions for different vehicles.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Beneficial Sharing of Boarding Pass and Instructions for Different Vehicles

**Description**: As a user of the boarding pass system, I want the process of sharing boarding passes and vehicle-specific instructions to be transparent and clearly communicated, ensuring that I understand how to use them across different vehicles, so that I can efficiently and safely manage my travel.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Beneficence

text: The system can provide a standby system in place should the traffic lights fail or a human traffic warden that will help direct traffic for ship loading and unloading.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement Standby Traffic Management System for Ship Loading/Unloading Operations

**Description**: As a port administrator, I want the system to have a standby traffic management solution in place, which can be either an automated backup system or a human traffic warden, to manage traffic efficiently during the loading and unloading of ships in case the primary traffic lights fail. This ensures continuous and reliable operation, maintaining safety and minimizing disruptions.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: Digital scanners that synchronize passenger information with regulations such as alcohol limits that can be brought in and to ensure that drunk or underage passengers are not driving.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Safe and Responsible Passenger Screening

**Description**: Implement digital scanners that sync passenger information with relevant regulations, such as alcohol limits and age verification, to ensure that drunk or underage individuals are not driving. This system aims to prevent potential harm to passengers and the public while promoting a safer transportation environment.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Beneficence

text: The system can provide a standby system in place should the traffic lights fail or a human traffic warden that will help direct traffic for ship loading and unloading.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fail-Safe Mechanism for Traffic Management System

**Description**: As a responsible AI-system developer, I want to implement a standby system for traffic management that includes either an automatic fail-safe mechanism or a human traffic warden, to ensure the safety and continuous flow of traffic during ship loading and unloading operations in case the primary traffic light system fails.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Responsibility

text: Regular digital or even manual information system checks with prompts informing on current updates such as parking information, duration of parking, etc.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Trustworthy Information Updates for Parking System

**Description**: As a user of the parking system, I need regular digital or manual information checks with clear and prompt updates on current parking information, including duration of parking, available spots, and any changes in policies or fees. This information should be easily accessible and reliable so that I can make informed decisions and trust the system's accuracy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Digital verification devices such as number plate scanners for vehicles to ensure that vehicle is authentic and in line with regulations and biometic scanner for human passengers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Implementation of Digital Verification Devices

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to ensure that digital verification devices, such as number plate scanners for vehicles and biometric scanners for human passengers, are implemented responsibly. This includes securing passenger data, maintaining system integrity, and ensuring the technology is trustworthy, in order to provide reliable and secure verification while protecting users' privacy and upholding ethical standards.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: APIs and Interoperable systems that can provide accurate data records from different teriminals and can synchronize efficiently with the ports System
ethical_us:
**Title**: Interoperable and Transparent Data Synchronization for Port Systems

**Description**: As a port system administrator, I need APIs and interoperable systems that can provide accurate data records from different terminals and synchronize efficiently with the port’s system, ensuring that data processes are fully transparent and builds our stakeholders' trust.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: System provides clear and transparent information without any ambiguity at remote terminals and at digital terminals and with people who check in passengers at the port.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Transparent Information for All Terminals

**Description**: As a user of the port system, I need clear and transparent information at both remote and digital terminals, as well as from personnel who check in passengers at the port, so that I can trust the information provided and ensure there is no ambiguity in my experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: AI integrated into the system that can help identify data patterns for users with special needs and provide necessary information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible AI for Users with Special Needs

**Description**: As a user with special needs, I want the AI integrated into the system to identify data patterns specific to my requirements and provide relevant information, ensuring equitable access and beneficial support tailored to my unique needs.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Beneficence

text: A clear and well defined HCI system where voice can be used to communicate data consent in line with relevant regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Voice-Based Consent for Data Sharing

**Description**: As a user, I want a clear and well-defined Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) system where I can use my voice to communicate data consent. The system must comply with relevant regulations and provide transparent information on how my data will be used, ensuring my privacy is protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: A centralized data management system with clearly outlined details on access rights and clear logs on users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Centralized Data Management with Transparent Access and Logging

 **Description**: As a data management platform user, I want a centralized system with clearly defined access rights and comprehensive logging of user actions, so that I can trust the system to transparently manage and secure data access and usage.

 **Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Booking information does not exclude anyone from the needed identification information and the booking application has the identification information as a mandatory field.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inclusive Booking Information Requirement

**Description**: As a user of the booking application, I want the identification information to be a mandatory field to ensure that no one is excluded from the required identification information, promoting fairness and transparency in the booking process.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Transparency

text: Ensure the quality of the data by testing. Testing at least with race, gender, age should be done and variance between gropes should not be significant. Realtime testing in real context needs to be done before launch.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Equitable and Trustworthy Data Quality Testing 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure the quality of the data by conducting thorough testing that includes checks for race, gender, and age, so that the variance between groups is not significant. Additionally, I want to conduct real-time testing in real-world contexts before launch to guarantee the fairness and reliability of the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Trust

text: I while shopping in the termina I lost track of time and I need to locate my self in the terminal. Mobile app or feature in terminal enduser app for navigation. System has Opt-in policy. Treminal has tracking points, sensors or QR code to provide tracing of the users movements and provide indor navigation to desired points.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Indoor Navigation Assistance in Terminals

**Description**: As a terminal user, I want an indoor navigation feature in the terminal’s mobile application or dedicated feature, which I can opt into, to help me locate myself and navigate effectively within the terminal without losing my autonomy. This system will use tracking points, sensors, or QR codes to provide accurate indoor navigation while ensuring that my movements are traced ethically and for the sole purpose of beneficence.

**Ethical principles used**: freedom and autonomy, beneficence

text: When auditing is in process system need to provide detailed documentation in every level of system architecture. Also 3rd party components needs to be documented or at least links to those systems documentation needs to Available.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Comprehensive Documentation for Auditing Processes

**Description**: As a user, I need the system to provide detailed documentation at every level of the system architecture during auditing processes. Additionally, the system should document all third-party components or provide links to their documentation to ensure that all elements are transparent and accountable.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: System needs to provide process documentation and specs for new service joining the system. List of acceptable actions should be given. E.g. are there restrictions of data usage, bandwidth, number of API queries
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Detailed Process Documentation and Specifications for New Services

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide comprehensive process documentation and specifications when a new service joins the system. This documentation should include acceptable actions, such as restrictions on data usage, bandwidth, and the number of API queries, ensuring clarity and accountability.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: System needs to provide user friendly and short description of the traceability features of the service and also provide instructions to take acting to access traceability. System needs also be able to end user notifications on traceability if user wishes
ethical_us:
**Title**: Providing Transparent and Accessible Traceability Features 

**Description**: As an end user, I want to have clear, concise, and user-friendly descriptions of the traceability features of the service. I also want straightforward instructions on how to access these traceability features, and I wish to receive notifications on traceability if I opt-in. This will ensure that I can easily understand and utilize the traceability features, while having the autonomy to choose whether or not I receive notifications.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: Smart terminal system need to have API for BI tool so that the service provider can track the service usage.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible API Integration for Service Tracking

**Description**: As a service provider, I need the smart terminal system to have an API for the BI tool that allows transparent tracking of service usage. This API should provide clear, understandable, and accurate data, ensuring that the service usage metrics are fully accountable. This will help maintain the responsibility of tracking and reporting, promoting trust and integrity in service monitoring.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: System should create explicit action log of its actions. The logs should be accessible for Designated personnel and understandable or reliably interpretable for government or other officials who require the logs for a legitimate reason.
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Action Logging and Accessibility 

**Description**: As a designated personnel member, I want the system to create an explicit and understandable log of its actions, so that the logs can be accessed and reliably interpreted by government officials or other authorized individuals who require them for legitimate reasons. This will ensure that the system operates with transparency and allows for accountability and responsibility.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: Systems identifies users with special need and  has feature to inform terminal service provider of required help. Systems also need to be available to tract special need aids inside the Terminal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Assistive Technology for Users with Special Needs

**Description**: As a terminal service provider, I want the system to identify users with special needs and provide features to notify staff of their required assistance. Additionally, the system should be capable of tracking assistive devices within the terminal to ensure they are readily available and accessible to those in need. This not only ensures equitable access but actively strives to improve the experience and well-being of users with special needs, promoting fairness and societal benefit.

**Ethical principles used**: Beneficence, Justice and Fairness

text: AI system needs to have a function to generate an explanation for its actions if requested by a system administrator with rights to access the System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Explanation Generation for AI Actions

**Description**: As a system administrator with the appropriate rights, I want the AI system to have a function that generates a clear and understandable explanation for its actions upon request. This enables me to ensure responsible use and maintain transparency of the AI system's decision-making process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: Function level documentation needs to be in Place.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Comprehensive Function-Level Documentation

**Description**: As a system developer, I want to provide detailed function-level documentation to ensure that all stakeholders can understand and verify how the system functions, thereby fostering transparency and building trust in the system's reliability and integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: System needs to be tested with given number of versatile use cases and not only obvious use cases with acceptable results. Also, those cases that would be possible but not testes should be clary stated.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Comprehensive and Transparent Testing of AI Systems

**Description**: As an ethical AI developer, I want to ensure that the AI system is rigorously tested with a diverse set of use cases, including less obvious scenarios, to deliver reliable and trustworthy results. Additionally, I will clearly document and communicate the use cases that were possible but not tested to maintain transparency and trust with stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Transparency

text: When planning my budget for freighting my  goods, i would like clear information on the different pricing options (aggregated prices) maybe in an app, sites or displayboards at the terminal to help me plan my budget effectively.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Clear and Accessible Pricing Information for Freight Planning 

**Description**: As a user planning my freight budget, I want clear and easily accessible information on the different pricing options (aggregated prices) available via an app, website, or display boards at the terminal. This will empower me to make informed decisions and plan my budget effectively.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: clear and well defined pricing criteria such as pricing analysis for customers on the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Trustworthy Pricing Criteria

**Description**: As a customer, I want the pricing criteria to be clear and well-defined, including detailed pricing analysis available on the system, so that I can trust the fairness and transparency of the costs associated with the products and services.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: When making inquiries as a customer, are there  pointers to say you are communicating with a virtual assistant and is there provision for a human assistant where possible?
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Identification of Virtual Assistants

**Description**: As a customer, I want to be clearly informed when I am communicating with a virtual assistant and have the option to request a human assistant where possible. This ensures that I am aware of whom I am interacting with and have the autonomy to choose a human assistant if needed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: When asked system documentation need to have description on what kind of data and from where was used to teach the system. Data set with out clear description should not be used.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear Documentation of Data Provenance

**Description**: As a user, I need the system documentation to include detailed descriptions of the types of data used and their sources, ensuring that datasets without clear descriptions are not utilized, so that I can understand the origins and nature of the data that taught the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: In service critical or human relating features only explainable AI/ML solutions are used. When requested the system can provide reasoning behind given result.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Explainable AI/ML Solutions for Service-Critical or Human-Related Features

**Description**: As a user, I want the AI/ML solutions used in service-critical or human-related features to be explainable, so that I can understand the reasoning behind the generated results whenever requested. This will foster transparency and build trust in the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: When prompted by passengers, the system should be able to provide information requested, eg customer asking for summary on a trip should be able to get one from the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent and Accessible Trip Information

**Description**: As a passenger, I want the system to provide clear and detailed information about my trip when requested so that I can fully understand my journey and make informed decisions about my travel.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: Before implementation, there should be a way to verify that the system is following the best practices and aligned with required legal Standards.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Verification of System Compliance with Best Practices and Legal Standards

**Description**: As a responsible engineer, I want to ensure that before implementing the system, there is a robust verification process in place to validate that the system adheres to best practices and legal standards, so that stakeholders can trust the system's integrity and compliance.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: A detailed document explaining the extent of the system's data use should be prepared and available to customers upon request.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent Data Use Documentation

**Description**: As a customer, I want to have access to a detailed document explaining the extent of the system's data use, so that I can understand how my personal information is being utilized and ensure my privacy is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The user is offered an easy to read statement of data privacy policies excercised with the terminal services for the services she is using (off the app) . She can opt in and out of data collection not necessary for my need of services.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Consent and Clear Data Privacy Policies  

**Description**: As a user, I want to be presented with an easy-to-read statement of the data privacy policies exercised with the terminal services I am using. Additionally, I want the ability to opt in and out of data collection that is not necessary for my use of the services, ensuring that my autonomy and preferences are respected.  

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Freedom and Autonomy

text: System provides Data collection description and  Data restrictions. Relevant contact information. Way to notify errors
ethical_us:
**Title**: Comprehensive Data Handling and Error Notification

**Description**: 
As a user, I want the system to clearly describe the data collection methods, data usage restrictions, and provide relevant contact information, so that I can fully understand and trust how my data is being handled. Additionally, I want the system to offer a straightforward way to report any errors or issues encountered, ensuring accountability and maintaining transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: Clear security communication to passengers who intend to use the terminal services, about what data is collected and how it is used.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Clear Security Communication to Passengers

**Description**: As a passenger intending to use the terminal services, I want to receive clear and transparent communication about what data is collected from me and how it will be used, so that I can make informed decisions about my privacy and feel secure.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: Video recordings and such unanonymized identifying data are only available to few certified people
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access to Unanonymized Identifying Data

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want video recordings and other unanonymized identifying data to be accessible only to a select group of certified individuals, ensuring privacy and the prevention of potential harm.

**Ethical principles used**: privacy, non-maleficence

text: A register of personal data processing activities and their justification (basis for processing) is created, all involved parties are identified and this register is maintained and made available for needing parties.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Data Processing Register for Personal Data

**Description**: As a data controller, I want to create and maintain a register of personal data processing activities, including their justification (basis for processing) and identification of all involved parties, so that this register can be available for authorized parties to ensure accountability and protect users' privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Privacy

text: The data privacy notice is made available to the passenger (via the app she is using), which provides the purposes the personal data is used For.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Clear Data Privacy Notice in the App

**Description**: As a passenger using the app, I want to have access to a clear and comprehensive data privacy notice that specifies the purposes for which my personal data is being used, so I can make informed decisions about my privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: Use case coordinator has detailed plan of the  systems and components contributing to the smart terminal system and also disclosure from those parties if they need GDPR clearances.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Comprehensive System Planning and GDPR Compliance for Smart Terminal

**Description**: As a Use Case Coordinator, I want to have a detailed plan of the systems and components contributing to the smart terminal system, along with disclosures from all involved parties regarding the need for GDPR clearances, to ensure accountability, maintain integrity in the development process, and build trust with stakeholders and users by protecting data responsibly.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: The value add application the passenger is using needs to impelent a control which identifies, which data processing activities are necessary for which basic or added value services the user is considering to use and she can thus opt in or out of the service based on the data processed. The data the user has selected for her rights execution needs to be processed accordingly, e.g. anonymized, deleted or made available for the user to transfer to another service/download.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Data Control and Transparency for Value-Added Services

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to clearly identify which data processing activities are necessary for each basic or value-added service I am considering, so I can opt in or out based on the data being processed. Additionally, I want the application to process my selected data according to my rights (e.g., anonymize, delete, or make available for transfer/download).

**Ethical principles used**: Freedom and Autonomy, Trust

text: Data statements need to be available and also  descriptions what services optional and how to opt—out on those need to be implanted. Description of what parts of the system are used by harbor official and cannot by opt-outed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Communication and Data Transparency

**Description**: As a user, I want to have access to clear data statements and descriptions of optional services, including instructions on how to opt-out of these services. Additionally, I want transparent information about which parts of the system are used by harbor officials and cannot be opted out of, so that I am fully informed about my data usage and my privacy rights.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: System architecture needs to be draw and it needs to be shareable with relevant stakeholders. Possible security issues relating to architecture information sharing needs to be Mitigated.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Develop and Share Secure System Architecture

**Description**: As a developer, I need to create a clear and understandable system architecture diagram and ensure it is shared with all relevant stakeholders in a secure manner. This includes implementing measures to mitigate any potential security issues that could arise from information sharing, in order to maintain transparency and uphold our responsibility towards protecting sensitive data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: The system can notify users on their tickets and display boards that data being collected are used in line with GDPR. Also regular tesing and security checks to ensure that customer data are not being jeopardized.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Data Usage Notifications and Security for User Data

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to notify me on my tickets and display boards that the data being collected are used in compliance with GDPR. Furthermore, I want the system to undergo regular testing and security checks to ensure that my data is not being jeopardized.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Other forms of biometrics such as iris or finger print recognition as an alternative to facial Recogniton.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Alternative Biometric Recognition 

**Description**: As a user, I want the option to use alternative biometric forms such as iris or fingerprint recognition instead of facial recognition to ensure my privacy is protected and to avoid potential harm that may come from misuse or inaccuracies in facial recognition technology.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Non-maleficence

text: A regular testing protocol should be in place, to ensure the security of the system and protect against threats. The system should be kept updated and its resilience tested in regular Intervals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular Security Testing and System Updates Protocol

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want a regular testing protocol to be in place to ensure the security and resilience of the system. This protocol should include periodic updates and rigorous testing at regular intervals to protect against threats and prevent harm to the users and their data.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: Protocols for verifying that the system collects data accurately should be in place. The data accuracy and quality should be evaluated on a regular basis.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accurate and High-Quality Data Collection

**Description**: As a developer, I want to implement protocols that regularly verify and evaluate the accuracy and quality of the collected data, so that the system maintains reliability and avoids causing harm due to incorrect or poor-quality data.

**Ethical principles used**: 
- Trust 
- Non-maleficence

text: Ensure that channels used for data collection document processes to aid accuracy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Document and Communicate Data Collection Processes for Accuracy

**Description**: As an AI developer, I want to ensure that all channels used for data collection document their processes thoroughly and make this documentation transparent and accessible to relevant stakeholders. This practice will help in verifying the accuracy of the collected data and building trust with users and regulatory bodies by demonstrating our commitment to transparency and accuracy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Secure APIs to help enable the process and open data sources.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Securing APIs for Trustworthy and Privacy-Protected Data Access 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that APIs are secure to help enable the process and open data sources so that user data remains private and secure, thereby fostering trust in the system. Secure APIs will help prevent unauthorized access and data breaches, enabling users to feel confident that their information is safe.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: Documentation and logs of data sources for Traceability.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Documenting and Logging Data Sources for Traceability

**Description**: As a user, I want to ensure that all data sources used in the AI system are thoroughly documented and logged, so that the origins and usage of data can be easily traced. This will help me understand where the data comes from and ensure that my personal information is protected and handled responsibly.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: relevant Data sources (APIs) are open for data analyst from the system and not just generic Data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Access to Specific Data for Analysts

**Description**: As a data analyst, I want access to relevant data sources (APIs) from the system, rather than just generic data, to ensure the data I use is comprehensive and accurate for analysis, while maintaining transparency about data origins and safeguarding individual privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The system follows regulations on data privacy and ensures that data access is granted only to relevant personnel.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Data Privacy and Controlled Access

**Description**: The system must comply with regulations on data privacy and ensure that data access is strictly limited to relevant personnel. This includes implementing robust access controls, auditing access logs, and ensuring that sensitive information is protected against unauthorized access to maintain user trust.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Trust

text: Passengers can be notified by the system at collection points such as on remote terminals, or if they use apps at point of feeding their data why their data is being collected.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Data Collection Notification for Passengers

**Description**: As a passenger, I want to be notified by the system at collection points, such as remote terminals or through apps at the point of feeding my data, about why my data is being collected, so that I am fully informed and can make an educated decision about sharing my information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: Regular data checks embedded in system to notify appropriate personnel on lifecycle of data to ensure conformity to regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Embedded Regular Data Checks for Lifecycle Management

**Description**: As a developer, I want to integrate regular data checks into the system that notify appropriate personnel about the lifecycle of data, to ensure that the system conforms to all relevant privacy regulations and maintains user trust.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: System is continuously monitored for vulnerabilities. Penetration tests have been conducted, and new ones are conducted as Needed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Continuous Security Monitoring and Regular Penetration Testing

**Description**: As an AI system developer, I want to ensure that the system is continuously monitored for vulnerabilities and subjected to regular penetration tests, so that any potential security threats are identified and addressed promptly to maintain high levels of user trust and demonstrate our responsibility towards secure and reliable AI systems.

**Ethical Principles Used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: The extent of necessary human oversight has been determined. The employees in charge of overseeing the process have been appointed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Determine Human Oversight and Appoint Responsible Employees

**Description**: As an AI development team, we ensure that the necessary extent of human oversight for the AI system is determined and that employees are appropriately appointed to oversee the AI process. This ensures that there is accountable human intervention to prevent any potential harm caused by the AI system, thereby acting responsibly and minimizing risks.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: Systems have been integrated successfully.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Safe System Integration

**Description**: As a user, I want to ensure that systems are integrated successfully without causing any harm or security vulnerabilities, so that I can trust the technology to function effectively and protect my data responsibly.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: To protect against data pollution, e.g., disable the system from learning in use (offline). This is an on-going issue where solutions are evolving right now, and various measures should be Considered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Preventing Data Pollution in AI Learning Systems

**Description**: As a responsible AI developer, I want to disable the system from learning while in use (offline) to protect against data pollution. This measure, along with continuously evolved solutions, will be transparently communicated to ensure ongoing protection and maintain trust in the AI system.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Detailed security plan from architecture level to single system feature level is drawn and mitigation plan is in action
ethical_us:
**Title**: Create Detailed and Transparent Security Plan for All System Features 

**Description**: As a development team, we need to create a detailed security plan that addresses every system feature, ensuring that potential vulnerabilities are identified and a robust mitigation plan is put into place. This plan must be openly documented and accessible to all relevant stakeholders to uphold high standards of transparency and accountability. 

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: An action protocol should be prepared for the occasion of a successful security breach. The system should be tested and kept as invulnerable as possible, but the staff should also be trained to take action to minimize damage in case of a successful attack on the System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Develop and Implement a Security Breach Action Protocol

**Description**: As an AI development team, we want to create and implement a comprehensive action protocol for the occasion of a successful security breach. This protocol will include regular system testing and invulnerability enhancements, alongside ensuring that staff are well-trained to take immediate, effective action to minimize damage. This will help us maintain a high level of trust and fulfill our responsibility towards our users and stakeholders by protecting their data and minimizing potential harm.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: People flow management related systems and hardware specific security risk are recognized mitigated. Possibility of system failure scenarios tested and possible physical harm from these failures consider. Backup plan ready for full system failure.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Reliable People Flow Management System

**Description**: As a responsible organization, we must recognize and mitigate specific security risks related to systems and hardware in people flow management. We will test for potential system failure scenarios and consider the possible physical harm that could result from these failures. Additionally, we will prepare a comprehensive backup plan to address full system failures to ensure the safety and security of all individuals.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: Understandable description what AI system does and don’t do described for people working along side the system. Insides of the people working along side of these systems heard and involved in the design.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Inclusive AI System Documentation

**Description**: Ensure that the AI system has an understandable description of its capabilities and limitations, and that people working alongside the system are consulted and their insights incorporated in the design process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Justice and Fairness

text: All the digitalized aspects of border control need to be trained for as many exceptional or rare cases as possible, and a human officer should monitor the digitalized border control.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Exceptional Border Control Cases

**Description**: As a border control developer, I want the digitalized aspects of border control to be trained for as many exceptional or rare cases as possible, and I want a human officer to monitor the digitalized border control, ensuring that any anomalies or issues are addressed promptly and effectively. This will help maintain the integrity and reliability of the border control system, ensuring that it works as intended and builds trust with its users.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: A function that alerts the chief security officer when something unusual happens in the system and someone accesses it from an atypical source.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Security Alert System for Atypical Access

**Description**: As a responsible development team, we want to implement a function that alerts the chief security officer when there is an unusual activity or access from an atypical source, ensuring immediate action can be taken to protect the system and maintain trustworthiness.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: Cyber security of the system should be varified by testing by multiple professional parties, not just one.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Comprehensive Cybersecurity Validation 

**Description**: As a system owner, I want the cybersecurity of the system to be verified through testing by multiple professional parties, so that I can ensure the highest level of trust and prevent any potential harm to users.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: A regular testing protocol should be in place, to ensure the security of the system and protect against threats. The system should be kept updated and its resilience tested in regular Intervals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular Testing and Updating Protocol for Security and Resilience

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to implement a regular testing protocol that ensures the security of the system and protects it against threats. This protocol should include regular updates and resilience testing at defined intervals to maintain the integrity and reliability of the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Privacy plan should be placed in the internet page and linked to social media for everyone to see clearly.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Visibility of Privacy Plan

**Description**: As a user, I want the privacy plan to be visibly placed on the internet page and linked to social media platforms so that I can easily access and understand how my personal data is being handled.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: System should have Help line number to call or help button in an app in the system so that responsible parties can either fix the problem or provide alternative assistance.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible Support for Users 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to include a help line number to call or a help button in the app so that I can quickly and easily get assistance from responsible parties who can fix the problem or provide alternative help, ensuring my experience is positive and trustworthy.

**Ethical principles used**: Beneficence, Trust

text: Authentication measures for human oversight determined (e.g., physical access). Override/oversight measures tested for vulnerabilities and considered from cybersecurity perspective.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement Secure and Trustworthy Authentication Measures for Human Oversight

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that authentication measures for human oversight (such as physical access) are determined and tested for vulnerabilities. These measures will be evaluated from a cybersecurity perspective to ensure robust security and maintain trust. This will help ensure that human oversight is both responsible and trustworthy, mitigating potential risks and vulnerabilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: The passenger must be presented with any physical safety concerns of the system, analyzed and provided with assurance that no risk exist or some estimaton on the risk. (E.g. system might be exploited to track some imporant person's movements and plan physical assault on her or track peaks in terminal usage to plan terrorist activities for maximum damage). Such a estimation/statement could be provided as a pop-up or part of info page /FAQ.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inform Passengers of AI-Related Physical Safety Concerns

**Description**: As a passenger, I want to be clearly informed about any physical safety concerns related to the AI system, including potential risks such as tracking important individuals or planning harmful activities. This information should be provided to me either through a pop-up notification or as part of an information page/FAQ, and it should include an assurance that no risks exist or an estimation of the potential risks, so that I can make informed decisions about using the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Transparency

text: Employees have been trained to a) understand the system as a whole, b) understand the new processes, c) understand in detail the parts of the system they are actively working with, and (if relevant), d) operate any parts of the system they may need to (if not normally, then perhaps in case of unforeseen issues).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Comprehensive Employee Training

**Description**: As a responsible organization, we aim to train all employees to understand the entire system, comprehend new processes, have in-depth knowledge of the areas they work with, and be capable of operating any part of the system if needed. This ensures they can effectively manage unforeseen issues, promoting trust in our technological deployments.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Trust

text: The number of employees that need to be present to take over in case of any unforeseen issues has been determined. The relevant employees have been instructed how to take over in case any part of the process automation Fails.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Human Readiness for Automation Failures

**Description**: As a responsible organization, we have determined the number of employees required to be present to handle unforeseen issues in the event of process automation failure. These employees have been instructed and trained on how to effectively take over the processes, ensuring that no harm comes to the system or stakeholders due to automation failures.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: The system does not allow access to any vulnerable parts of the system to unauthorized Personnel.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access Control for System Vulnerabilities

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want the system to restrict access to all vulnerable parts to authorized personnel only, so that sensitive information and system integrity are protected from unauthorized access, thereby safeguarding user privacy and building trust with stakeholders.

**Ethical Principles Used**: Trust, Privacy

text: The system is clear and intuitive to use, and leaves as little as possible for interpretation. It will not offer possibilities for passengers to do a wrong, dangerous or forbidden thing.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Intuitive User Interface Preventing Harmful Actions

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be clear and intuitive to use, leaving as little as possible for interpretation. This will help ensure that I do not accidentally perform any wrong, dangerous, or forbidden actions.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Transparency

text: Human oversight procedures determined (e.g. when/how an employee can take control of the system or its tasks, or even shut it down).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Human Oversight and Control Procedures

**Description**: Implement comprehensive human oversight procedures detailing when and how employees can take control of the AI system or its tasks. These procedures should also clearly define scenarios in which employees are authorized to shut down the system to ensure safety and accountability. The goal is to promote transparency in the AI operation and uphold the responsibility of human oversight, ensuring that humans have the capability to intervene when necessary.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Intended system use clearly defined so that misuse can be determined. Expected outcomes/outputs determined for each process  employees should know how to expect the system to behave so they can determine if something is off. Human oversight procedures determined (e.g. when/how an employee can take control of the system or even shut it down).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Definition of System Use and Oversight

**Description**: Clearly define the intended use of the system to facilitate the identification of misuse. Determine and communicate expected outcomes and outputs for each process so employees can accurately gauge system behavior. Establish human oversight procedures, detailing when and how employees can intervene, take control, or shut down the system if necessary.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Intended system use clearly defined so that misuse can be determined. Liability established through contracts.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clearly Defined System Use and Liability through Contracts 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to clearly define the intended use of the system and establish liability through formal contracts, so that any potential misuse can be identified, and accountability can be ensured.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Documentation that clarifies the assigned responsible person for each part of the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clarified Responsibility for System Components

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want documentation that clearly identifies the individuals responsible for each part of the system, so that accountability is maintained and any issues can be addressed promptly and transparently.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: User and feasibility studies done for the planned system. Testing and scenarios before building. Feasible places for system automation Recognized.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Conduct Thorough Feasibility and Testing for Planned System 

**Description**: Before beginning the construction of the planned system, conduct detailed user and feasibility studies to ensure the system is well-understood and any potential drawbacks are identified. This includes testing through various scenarios to anticipate and mitigate potential issues. Additionally, identify feasible places for system automation, ensuring the system can be implemented effectively without harmful repercussions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Non-maleficence

text: Smart terminal system is tested from passenger point of view. Versatile scenarios and users are tested. Viewpoint of children is also covered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inclusive and Safe Testing of Smart Terminal System

**Description**: As a development team, we need to test the smart terminal system from the passenger's point of view, ensuring versatile scenarios and user types are included, with particular attention to children. This ensures the system is inclusive and does not cause harm, providing a fair and secure experience for all passengers.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Non-maleficence

text: Role-based access and rights implemented. Management and documentation of these roles Done.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Role-Based Access and Rights Management for Enhanced Accountability

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to implement role-based access and rights management, ensuring that each role is clearly defined and documented, to provide transparency and accountability in the system. This will facilitate traceability of actions and ensure that responsibilities are clear and verifiable, promoting the integrity and security of the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: A regular testing protocol should be in place, to ensure the security of the system and protect against threats. The system should be kept updated and its resilience tested in regular Intervals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular Security Testing Protocol Implementation

**Description**: As a responsible development team, we need to implement a regular testing protocol to ensure the security of the system and protect it against potential threats. This involves keeping the system updated and conducting resilience tests at regular intervals to prevent harm and build trust with our users.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: A human should surveil the actions of every AI System, particularly safety-critical processes/every AI system should have a designated employee who monitors its performance.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Human Oversight of AI Systems for Safety

**Description**: As a designated employee, I want to continuously monitor the performance and actions of AI systems, particularly those involved in safety-critical processes, to ensure they operate as intended and prevent any potential harm to individuals or society.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: Backup options and system downtime protocols should be established before launch, and all relevant stakeholders should be informed about the downtime protocols.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Establish Backup Options and Communicate Downtime Protocols

**Description**: As a system developer, I want to establish reliable backup options and detailed system downtime protocols before launch, and ensure that all relevant stakeholders are informed about these protocols, so that there is transparency and accountability in managing downtime and preemptively addressing any disruptions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: Staff should finish training for emergency situations, to calm the passengers and guide them in a pre-planned way to safety efficiently. The system should also be ensured to communicate safety instructions to passengers Efficiently.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical User Story for Emergency Preparedness and Communication

**Description**: As an organisation responsible for the safety of passengers, we require that all staff complete comprehensive training for managing emergency situations effectively. This includes protocols for calming passengers and guiding them to safety in a planned, efficient manner. Additionally, we must ensure that the system communicates safety instructions to passengers in a clear and transparent way, helping to protect and benefit all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Beneficence, Transparency

text: Clear log and access report generated by the system on passengers from data collected. The system can also notify passengers on the period thier data will be kept while collecting the data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Data Logging and Notification for Passenger Data

**Description**: As a passenger, I want a clear log and access report generated by the system from the data collected about me, and I want to be notified about the period my data will be kept at the time of data collection, so I can understand and approve how my data is being used and for how long it will be stored.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: audition plan needs to be in place. System and its compnents are build and selected auditability in mind.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement an Audition Plan and Build Systems with Auditability

**Description**: As an ethical AI developer, I want to create and implement a detailed audition plan and ensure that the system and its components are designed with auditability in mind. This will allow for thorough reviews and assessments of the system's performance and compliance, promoting transparency and accountability.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Audit requirements have been written out in system description. Requirements have been discussed among all relevant parties related to systems development.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Documented and Discussed Audit Requirements

**Description**: As a responsible AI developer, I want all audit requirements to be thoroughly written out in the system description and discussed among all relevant parties, to ensure transparency in our AI development process and uphold accountability and responsibility.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: DPIA must be made to meet the given standards. If needed DPIA is aviabler Relevant stakeholders for the SMART terminal system need to beinformed about the required level of standards for Data and privacy when operating as a part of SMART terminal system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Informed Stakeholders and DPIA Compliance

**Description**: As a relevant stakeholder for the SMART terminal system, I need to be informed about the required level of standards for data and privacy when operating as part of the system, and ensure a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) is made and available to meet the given standards. This ensures transparency in communication and the protection of personal data within the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The system is designed and architecture is planned privacy and data protections auditability in mind. Clear documentation on how API and services joining the SMART terminal system will affect the privacy and data Protection.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Privacy and Data Protection Auditability

**Description**: As a system developer, I want the system to be designed and its architecture planned with privacy and data protection auditability in mind, so that clear documentation on how APIs and services joining the SMART terminal system will affect privacy and data protection is readily available.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Smart terminal system is a system of systems. The core system linking everything together needs to provide description responsibilities among systems linking to the system before service can come as partner to the system. Also requirements of information sharing and processing should be provided both ways.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Integration of Partner Systems

**Description**: The core system responsible for linking various subsystems must provide a clear and comprehensive description of responsibilities among these interconnected systems before any new service can partner with the system. Additionally, explicit requirements for bi-directional information sharing and processing must be provided to ensure transparency and accountability across all integrated systems.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: The system is created from modular parts, to what extent possible.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Modular System Design for Transparency and Sustainability

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to be created from modular parts to ensure transparency in its design and to promote sustainability. This will allow for easier understanding and explanation of each module's function, as well as facilitate maintenance, upgrades, and responsible disposal or recycling of components.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Sustainability

text: The system is audited by 3rd party experts as required by regulations/laws
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Audit by Independent Experts

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be regularly audited by 3rd party experts to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and laws, thereby promoting transparency and holding developers accountable.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: Developers should be aware that good usability instructions for developing are utilized when making the booking features / systems etc.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Usability Instructions for Development of Booking Features 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that clear and comprehensive usability instructions are utilized during the development of booking features and systems. This will enhance the user experience and benefit users by making the system more intuitive and efficient.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Beneficence

text: Datalifecycle plan is made by the information management team for the developers to use from the beginning of the development phase.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implementation of a Comprehensive Data Lifecycle Plan

**Description**: As a member of the information management team, I want to create a detailed data lifecycle plan that developers can use from the beginning of the development phase to ensure that all data handling practices are transparent and respect user privacy. This plan will cover data collection, storage, usage, and deletion processes, providing clear guidelines to safeguard personal information and maintain transparency for all stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Criteria list of different purposes detected from the information flow should be made and Maintained.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain a Criteria List for Different Data Purposes

**Description**: As a developer, I want to identify and maintain a criteria list for the different purposes detected from the information flow so that users are clearly informed about how their data is being collected, used, and shared. This approach will ensure that data usage aligns with stated purposes and that user privacy is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The flow of identity checking should be simulated and tested against identity teft issues.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Identity Verification Testing

**Description**: As a responsible AI developer, I want to simulate and rigorously test the identity verification process to ensure it effectively prevents identity theft and does not cause harm, so that users can trust the system to protect their personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Trust

text: System keeps track of all button presses and other actions and logs them. Activity associated with user accounts (where applicable).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Privacy-Respecting Activity Logging

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently log all button presses and other actions associated with my user account (where applicable) in a way that respects my privacy. This ensures that I am aware of how my interactions with the system are being recorded and that my personal data is securely and responsibly managed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The product shall ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized users. The product will be able to distinguish between authorized and unauthorized users in all access attempts.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Access Control for Authorized Users

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to ensure that it can only be accessed by authorized individuals, so that my personal information and data remain secure and my trust in the system is maintained. This includes distinguishing between authorized and unauthorized users in every access attempt to prevent unauthorized access and safeguard user privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: The system shall offer a display of all the Events in the exercise.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Display of Exercise Events 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide an accessible and understandable display of all the events in the exercise so that I can clearly see and comprehend all relevant activities without confusion, ensuring my dignity and respect are upheld through straightforward communication.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only registered realtors shall be able to access the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Access Control for Realtors 

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only registered realtors can access the system, so that user information remains secure and system operations are transparent. This involves setting up a robust authentication mechanism to verify the identity of users and ensuring that access logs are maintained and accessible for auditing purposes.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: Every user of the system shall be authenticated and authorized.
ethical_us:
