**Title**: User Authentication and Authorization for Privacy and Transparency

**Description**: As a user of the system, I want to be authenticated and authorized before accessing any functionalities to ensure that my personal data is protected, and I have a clear understanding of the authorization process. This will help in maintaining my privacy and providing transparency about who can access what resources within the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: The product shall prevent its data from incorrect data being introduced.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Data Integrity

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to have mechanisms in place to prevent incorrect data from being introduced, so that I can trust the accuracy and reliability of the information the product provides, and developers are held responsible for maintaining high data quality standards.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Responsibility

text: Only authorized users shall have access to students' personal information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to Students' Personal Information

**Description**: As an IT administrator, I want to ensure that only authorized users have access to students' personal information so that the privacy of the students is protected, and the processes involved in accessing the information are transparent and well-documented.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: The system shall protect private information in accordance with the organization's information policy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Respect Privacy and Build Trust through Robust Information Protection

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to protect my private information in accordance with the organization's information policy so that I can trust that my data is secure and my privacy is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: The system shall have basic data integrity checking to reduce the possibility of incorrect or invalid data being introduced.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Data Integrity in the System

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to perform basic data integrity checks to reduce the possibility of incorrect or invalid data being introduced. This will ensure that the data being processed is accurate and reliable, and that I can trust the system's outputs and be confident in making decisions based on the data provided.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: The system shall be built such that it is as secure as possible from malicious interference.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Security Against Malicious Interference

**Description**: As a user of the system, I want the system to be built with maximum security measures to protect against malicious interference, ensuring the integrity of my data and experience is preserved.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: The product must comply with Sarbanes-Oxley.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley Act

**Description**: As a company, we need to design and implement our product in a way that ensures strict adherence to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act. This involves transparent and accurate financial reporting, and maintaining accountability and stringent internal controls to prevent fraud and errors, thereby maintaining integrity and trustworthiness with stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: The system shall prevent malicious attacks including denial of service.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure System to Prevent Malicious Attacks

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to incorporate robust security measures to prevent malicious attacks, including denial of service, so that I can trust the system to safeguard my data and ensure continuous, harm-free operation.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Non-maleficence

text: The product shall conform to the Americans with Disabilities Act.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessibility Compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

**Description**: As a user with disabilities, I want the product to comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) so that I can access and use the product without facing any barriers, ensuring my inherent dignity is respected and my needs are responsibly considered by the developers.

**Ethical principles used**: Dignity, Responsibility

text: The product shall have the ability to receive automatic software updates as new threats emerge. 100% of customers will be able to receive automatic software updates transmitted to the installed product.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Automatic Software Updates for Threat Protection

**Description**: As a user of the product, I want to receive automatic software updates as new threats emerge, ensuring that my product is continuously protected against potential harms. This will ensure that 100% of customers receive timely and essential security updates transmitted directly to their installed products, upholding both user safety and system integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Non-maleficence

text: The System shall meet all applicable accounting standards. The final version of the System must successfully pass independent audit performed by a certified auditor.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance and Auditability for Accountable and Transparent Financial Systems

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want the system to meet all applicable accounting standards and successfully pass an independent audit performed by a certified auditor, ensuring the integrity and transparency of the financial data and processes within the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Responsibility

text: The System shall be able to automatically backup business data and restore them on demand.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Automatic Data Backup and Restoration with Transparent Processes for Harm Prevention

**Description**: As a business user, I want the system to automatically backup business data and allow me to restore it on demand, ensuring that these processes are transparent and clearly documented to prevent any potential harm or data loss.

**Ethical principles used**: Non-maleficence, Transparency

text: The website shall make its user aware of its information practices before collection data from them via a Privacy Policy, accessible on all pages of the website.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inform Users of Data Collection Practices

**Description**: As a user, I want to be aware of the website's information practices before it collects any data from me, by having access to a clearly displayed Privacy Policy on all pages, ensuring I understand how my data will be used and respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall notify customers of changes to its information policy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Customers of Changes to Information Policy 

**Description**: As a user, I want to be promptly notified of any changes to the system's information policy so that I can stay informed and trust that the system respects my data and privacy rights.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: The system shall reveal private information only in compliance with the organizations information policy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Adherence to Information Policy for Revealing Private Information

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to reveal private information only in compliance with the organization's information policy, ensuring that my privacy is protected and I can trust that my data is handled responsibly.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: All credit card information will be encrypted in the database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Encrypt Credit Card Information in Database

**Description**: As a user, I want my credit card information to be encrypted in the database so that my sensitive data is protected and my trust in the system is upheld, with transparent methods to understand how my data is safeguarded.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Trust

text: Daily usage statistics should be logged  and accessible by the administrator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Privacy-Respecting Usage Logging

**Description**: As an AI system administrator, I need to ensure that daily usage statistics are logged and accessible in a manner that is transparent and respects user privacy. This will help me monitor system performance and usage patterns without compromising the confidentiality of user data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: For leads that process longer than 25 seconds the system will record the event and duration
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparency and Privacy Compliance in Lead Processing

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to record the event and duration of any lead processing that takes longer than 25 seconds, ensuring that the information is transparent and the privacy of the data collected is protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The product shall protect the identity of the players. The product shall provide players no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Protect Player Identity

**Description**: As a player, I want my identity to be protected and not revealed to other players so that my personal privacy is maintained. Additionally, I should not have access to information that could reveal the identity of another player, ensuring that everyone's privacy is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Privacy, Transparency

text: The product shall be available to players who understand English, Spanish and French. The product shall allow the user to select the language upon accessing the product.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Multilingual Accessibility for Users

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to select my preferred language (English, Spanish, or French) when accessing the product so that I can easily understand and use the product’s features.

**Ethical principles used**: Justice and fairness, Transparency

text: The system shall have high availability every day of the year. The system must be available for use between 12:00AM and 6:00PM all days of the year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring High System Availability and Transparent Communication

**Description**: As a user of the system, I want the system to be highly available every day of the year, specifically between 12:00AM and 6:00PM, to ensure I can trust and rely on it for my daily tasks. Furthermore, I want clear and transparent communication regarding system availability and any potential downtime to ensure I am well-informed and can plan accordingly.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: The product shall provide GUI based Monitoring Services. System Administrators shall monitor message exchanges will predict and determine problems and will also provide internal and external support.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Monitoring and Support System

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want the product to provide GUI-based monitoring services that respect user privacy and ensure transparency. The monitoring system should allow me to oversee message exchanges clearly, predict and determine problems, and provide both internal and external support while ensuring that the data being monitored is handled responsibly and communicated transparently.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: The product shall be available 99% of the time. Rationale: To avoid service interruption during busiest customer service response periods. The product shall be available 99.99% of the time for regular business days.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure High Availability to Minimize Service Interruptions

**Description**: As a customer service manager, I want the product to have an availability rate of 99% during the busiest periods and 99.99% during regular business days, so that service interruptions are minimized and customer support can operate efficiently without disruptions.

**Ethical principles used**: Responsibility, Transparency

text: The product shall information Security. The product shall enable privacy by encryption WS-Security and Integrity Checking
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Information Security and Privacy Protection

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to guarantee the security of my sensitive information by enabling robust privacy measures such as WS-Security and integrity checking through encryption. This ensures that my data is protected from unauthorized access and tampering, building trust in the system's safety and reliability.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement Audit Capabilities with Privacy Safeguards

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to have audit capabilities that store messages for a minimum of one year, ensuring transparency while safeguarding the privacy of personal data. This will help in tracking transactions and maintaining accountability without compromising individual privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Privacy

text: All changes  updates  and additions to the WCS system shall be updated in the WCS Developer and WCS User Guides. Every change must be reflected in WCS system documentation
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Comprehensive Documentation Updates for WCS System

**Description**: As a WCS developer and user, I want all changes, updates, and additions to the WCS system to be meticulously documented in the WCS Developer and WCS User Guides. This will ensure that every modification is reflected in the system documentation, promoting transparency and respecting the dignity of the users by enabling them to understand and use the system effectively.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall display and embed in each message a date/timestamp of when the message was sent.
ethical_us:

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display and embed in each message a date and timestamp of when the message was sent, so that I can clearly understand the context and timing of communications, and ensure that the integrity and dignity of the messages are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All network transactions that involve financial information or personally identifiable information shall be encrypted.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Encrypt Financial and Personal Network Transactions

**Description**: As a user, I want all network transactions that involve financial information or personally identifiable information to be encrypted, so that my sensitive data remains secure and my privacy is protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Trust, Privacy

text: System use shall not cause any harm to human users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Harm to Human Users

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to operate in a way that ensures no harm comes to me, meaning I am protected from any physical, emotional, or psychological harm. Additionally, I want to understand how the system implements measures to prevent harm so that I can trust its usage.

text: The system should warn ECA users about the malfunction of the system.
ethical_us:

text: The system shall provide multi language support.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Multi-Language Support for Inclusive Access

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide multi-language support so that individuals from all linguistic backgrounds can access and utilize the system without barriers, ensuring everyone is treated with dignity and fairness.

**Ethical principles used**: Dignity, Justice and Fairness

text: The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Refresh Transparency and User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently refresh the display every 60 seconds, ensuring that I am always looking at the most up-to-date and accurate information without feeling overwhelmed or disoriented. This will respect my dignity by keeping me well-informed and minimizing confusion.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Color Schema Matching

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If projected  the data must be readable.  On a 10x10 projection screen  90% of viewers must be able to read Event / Activity data from a viewing distance of 30
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Readability of Projected Event/Activity Data

**Description**: As a user, I need the projected event/activity data to be readable on a 10x10 projection screen so that 90% of the viewers can easily read it from a distance of 30 feet. This ensures that all users, regardless of their visual acuity, can equally access and understand the information being displayed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC  the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Availability and User Empowerment

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be available 99% of the time during normal business hours for the first six months of operation, so that I can trust it to perform my tasks reliably. Additionally, I want clear, understandable communication from the developers regarding system uptime and any potential issues, so my dignity as a knowledgeable and responsible user is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If projected  the data must be understandable. On a 10x10 projection screen  90% of viewers must be able to determine that Events or Activities are occuring in current time from a viewing distance of 100
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Understandable and Timely Data Presentation for All Viewers

**Description**: As a viewer, I need to be able to clearly understand events or activities occurring in real-time when projected on a 10x10 screen from a distance of 100 meters. The data presentation should be clear and comprehensible for at least 90% of the audience, ensuring that the information is transparent and respects the dignity of all viewers by providing equal access to the correct information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fast and Respectful Response Times for Up-To-Date Data Display  

**Description**: As a user, I expect the product to respond quickly and reliably to ensure that the data displayed is up-to-date, clear, and easy to understand, while also respecting my dignity by providing accurate and timely information. The system should transparently communicate any delays or data issues in a manner that respects user dignity and trust. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.
ethical_us:

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a multi-document interface (MDI) form that allows for the simultaneous viewing of both the graph and the data table. This interface should clearly explain how the data is represented and ensure that the information is presented in a way that respects all individuals represented in the data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Event Display

**Description**: As a user, I want the display to be organized with the left 2/3 as a graphical representation and the right 1/3 as a data table, ensuring that information is presented clearly and accessibly. This layout should respect my need to understand and interpret data easily while dignifying my experience by providing an intuitive and non-confusing interface.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The data displayed in both the nodes within the graph and the rows in the table are MSEL Summary data
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Display of MSEL Summary Data

**Description**: As a user, the data displayed in both the nodes within the graph and the rows in the table should transparently present MSEL Summary data to ensure that users understand the information comprehensively and that their inherent dignity is respected. Appropriate measures should be taken to provide clear explanations and context for the data shown, ensuring that all users can interpret the data correctly and meaningfully.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The table side of the display shall be split into 2 regions: sequential and temporal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Display Segmentation for Clarity and User Respect

**Description**: As a user, I want the table side of the display to be clearly split into two distinct regions—sequential and temporal—so that I can easily understand and interpret the data presented, ensuring a more transparent experience while respecting my cognitive abilities and time.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The top 1/4 of the table will hold events that are to occur sequentially.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Sequential Event Transparency and User Dignity in Table Interface

**Description**: As a user, I need the top 1/4 of the table to clearly display events that are to occur sequentially so that I can understand the sequence and ensure my interaction with the system is respectful of my time and cognitive load.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The bottom 3/4 of the table will hold events that occur according to its relevance to current time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Displaying Time-Relevant Events Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As a user, I want the bottom 3/4 of the table to transparently display events in order of their relevance to the current time, ensuring that the presentation respects the dignity of all individuals involved. This includes clear labeling and explanations for why certain events are highlighted, so that I can fully understand the context and significance of each event.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall color code events according to their variance from current time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Event Color Coding for Enhanced User Understanding

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to color code events according to their variance from the current time, so that I can easily understand and interpret the timing of events without confusion or misinterpretation. This feature ensures that users have a clear and understandable visual representation of event timing, thereby maintaining their dignity and allowing for transparency in the scheduling process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall display data from the Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0 applications
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Display for Sync Matrix 1.0 and Exercise Management Tool 1.0

Additionally, the system should ensure that this transparency respects my dignity by preventing any potential misuse or misinterpretation of my personal data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall link Events back to either the Sync Matrix 1.0 or the Exercise Managment Tool 1.0 applications for modifications.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow modification of the display.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable User-Friendly Display Customization 

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to modify the display settings of the system to suit my preferences and needs. This customization will ensure that I can interact with the system in a way that respects my inherent dignity and is transparent in its options and processes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall filter data by: Venues and Key Events.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Filtering by Venues and Key Events

**Description**: As a user, I need the system to transparently filter data by venues and key events in a manner that respects the dignity of all individuals, ensuring that the data and its presentation are clear and unambiguous.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall display the local and exercise time in separate clocks
ethical_us:
**Title**: Separate Display of Local and Exercise Time

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display the local time and exercise time on separate clocks so that I can clearly differentiate between the two and manage my activities with clarity and respect for my time management needs.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall offer the ability to pause and resume the refresh of data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Allow Users to Pause and Resume Data Refresh

**Description**: As a user, I want the ability to pause and resume the data refresh process, so that I can review, understand, and control the influx of new information without overwhelming my current workflow or impacting my decision-making process.

**Ethical principles used**:
- **Transparency**: Enabling users to pause and resume data refresh promotes clarity and understanding of when new data is being integrated, enhancing the overall transparency of the system's operations.
- **Dignity**: Providing users with control over data refresh respects their autonomy and acknowledges their inherent worth, allowing them to manage their interaction with the system in a way that suits their individual needs and preferences.

text: The system shall provide charts for the Activity or Event actual versus assumed time.
ethical_us:

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide clear and understandable charts comparing the actual versus assumed time for activities or events, ensuring that the data is presented transparently and respectfully, recognizing my right to accurate and dignified information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall provide a history report of changes made to the Activity or Event data
ethical_us:

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The look and feel of the system shall conform to the user interface standards of the smart device.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain User Interface Standards for System Accessibility

**Description**: As a user, I want the look and feel of the system to conform to the user interface standards of the smart device so that I can easily understand and navigate the system without confusion, ensuring that my experience respects my dignity and is transparent in its operation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall have a professional appearance

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Out of 1000 accesses to the system the system is available 999 times.
ethical_us:

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be available 999 out of 1000 accesses so that I can reliably perform my tasks without unnecessary interruptions. Additionally, I want the platform to transparently communicate any downtimes or maintenance schedules to respect my time and need for continuous access.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall operate in offline mode whenever internet connection is unavailable.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Offline Mode Availability for User Respect

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to operate in offline mode whenever an internet connection is unavailable, ensuring that I can access essential features and maintain my workflow without unnecessary interruptions or dependencies on continuous connectivity. This respects my inherent dignity by acknowledging my needs and providing a seamless user experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow the user to view previously downloaded search results CMA reports  and appointments.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Access to Historical Data

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to view my previously downloaded search results, CMA reports, and appointments in a clear and accessible manner, so that I can understand my past interactions with the product and use this information to make informed decisions without feeling confused or disrespected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall retain user preferences in the event of a failure.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Preserve User Preferences During System Failures

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to securely retain my preferences even in the event of a system failure, ensuring that my settings are respected and reinstated once the system is operational again. This helps me maintain a consistent and dignified user experience without unnecessary reconfiguration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 100% of saved user preferences shall be restored when system comes back online.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Preserve and Restore User Preferences with Transparency and Respect for Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to fully restore my saved preferences when it comes back online so that I can continue using the service seamlessly. The process should be clearly communicated to me, ensuring that I understand how my preferences are saved and restored, respecting my dignity as an individual.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be able to support multiple remote users
ethical_us:
**Title**: Support for Multiple Remote Users with Transparent Operations and User Dignity

**Description**: As a remote user, I want the product to support multiple users simultaneously in a way that provides clear and understandable information about operational processes and respects my inherent worth, ensuring my rights are respected while using the platform.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be able support 1000 simultaneous users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Capacity Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want to be informed clearly about the platform's ability to support up to 1000 simultaneous users, so that I can trust the system's capacity and feel respected in my usage experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be capable of handling the existing 1000 users. This number is expected to grow 5 times within the next year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Scalable and Respectful User Capacity Management

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to transparently inform me about its capacity to handle the current and expected user base growth, ensuring that my interactions and data are managed with dignity and without any disruptions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be installed by an untrained realtor without recourse to separately-printed instructions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Accessible Installation Instructions for Realtors

**Description**: As a real estate company, we want to ensure that the product installation process is transparent and easily understandable for realtors, regardless of their training. This involves integrating clear, step-by-step digital instructions directly into the product interface, ensuring that all realtors can install it without the need for separately-printed instructions. This approach respects the dignity of realtors by acknowledging their diverse skill levels and ensuring they feel confident and respected during the installation process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 90% of untrained realtors shall be able to install the product on their device without printed instructions
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Installation for Untrained Realtors

**Description**: As an untrained realtor, I want to be able to install the product on my device without needing printed instructions, so that I feel respected and empowered, and the installation process is clear and understandable.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product is expected to run on Windows CE and Palm operating systems.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Cross-Platform Transparency and Dignity 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to run transparently on Windows CE and Palm operating systems, ensuring that it respects user dignity by providing a consistent experience and not exploiting any inherent weaknesses or exploitable features in these platforms.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow a real estate agent to query MLS information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful MLS Query for Real Estate Agents

**Description**: As a real estate agent, I want to query MLS (Multiple Listing Service) information in a manner that is fully transparent and respectful of all parties involved, including the property owners and prospective buyers. The system should provide clear and understandable information about how queries are processed and presented, ensuring that no misleading or disrespectful data is shared.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user shall be able to get driving directions to a selected property
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Driving Directions with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want to receive driving directions to a selected property in a transparent manner so that the data used to generate the directions is clear and understandable. The system should respect my dignity by ensuring that the directions are accurate and considerate of my personal needs.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user shall be able to download appointments and contact information for clients
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Access for Client Information 

**Description**: As a user, I want the ability to download appointments and contact information for clients, ensuring that the process is transparent and respects the dignity of the clients by protecting their personal information and clearly communicating how their data will be used and stored.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall display clear property images in the search results
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enhance Image Clarity for Property Listings

**Description**: As a user seeking properties, I want the system to display clear and accurate images in the search results so that I can make informed decisions based on true representations of the properties, thus respecting my right to adequate information and ensuring the transparent presentation of data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall update or create new property listings in the MLS
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Management of Property Listings

**Description**: As an ethical property management system, I want to ensure that new or updated property listings in the Multiple Listing Service (MLS) are created or modified with complete transparency. This includes providing clear, understandable information about the changes made and ensuring the dignity of all parties involved, so that users can trust that the information is accurate and representative of the properties listed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Realtor shall be able to generate a CMA report based on property criteria
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Generation of CMA Reports for Property Listings

**Description**: As a realtor, I want to generate a Comparative Market Analysis (CMA) report based on property criteria in a way that is transparent to my clients. This ensures they fully understand the evaluation process and confidently make informed decisions about their property’s value. Additionally, the process should respect the dignity of all stakeholders by using fair, unbiased data and methodology.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to call the seller or buyer to schedule an appointment
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Appointment Scheduling

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently inform me about the process of scheduling an appointment and ensure my dignity is upheld during the communication, so that I can trust the system and feel respected throughout the interaction.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The realtor shall be notified of new client appointments after automatic synchronization with office system
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Notification of New Client Appointments

**Description**: As a realtor, I want to be notified of new client appointments after an automatic synchronization with the office system, ensuring that the notification process is transparent and respects the dignity of all parties involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The realtor shall be able to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Property Locations on a Map with Transparent and Dignified User Experience

**Description**: As a realtor, I want to retrieve a map showing property locations for a specified area, ensuring the user interface and data presentation are clear and comprehensible. The map should be designed to respect the dignity of all users by avoiding any invasive data collection and ensuring the privacy and integrity of personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall notify the realtor when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Notification for Realtors

**Description**: As a realtor, I want the system to notify me transparently when a seller or buyer responds to an appointment request, ensuring that both parties' actions and intentions are respected and communicated clearly.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow the user to save the property search results.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Saving of Property Search Results

**Description**: As a user, I want to save my property search results in a transparent manner that respects my dignity, so I can trust how my data is being handled and feel confident that my rights are preserved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be easy to use by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Interface for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I need the system to be easy to use so that I can efficiently manage and operate the system without unnecessary stress or difficulty. This includes having clear instructions, intuitive navigation, and responsive support to ensure that I can focus on patient care and administrative duties without technical obstacles.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All of the users shall be able to use the system after one day of training.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessible and Understandable System Usage

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be designed in a way that ensures I can understand and use it effectively after one day of training, so I can maintain my dignity and trust in the system's transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall help the user avoid making mistakes while scheduling classes and clinicals for the nursing students.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Error Prevention in Class and Clinical Scheduling 

**Description**: As a system, I want to provide clear, understandable, and transparent guidance to users while scheduling classes and clinicals for nursing students, ensuring that their choices are well-informed and that they avoid potential mistakes. This will respect the dignity of both students and schedulers by preventing any confusion or scheduling conflicts that could adversely affect the students' educational experiences.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The number of mistakes noted by the students shall be decreased by 50% in the first year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Reduce Student Mistake Rate Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As an educational technology provider, we aim to reduce the number of mistakes noted by students by 50% in the first year by implementing transparent error-reporting and feedback mechanisms that respect student dignity. This will involve clearly explaining how errors are identified and allowing students to understand and correct their mistakes in a respectful and supportive manner.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 2 out of 3 Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall successfully be able to use the system to manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible and Understandable Scheduling System for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want an easily understandable and user-friendly scheduling system so that I can efficiently manage the scheduling of classes and clinicals, ensuring transparency in operations and maintaining the dignity of all users involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by the user community.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly and Understandable Communication

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to use symbols and words that are naturally understandable by my community, so that I can easily comprehend and interact with it without confusion or frustration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The verbiage used within the system shall be consistent with Standard English and the terminology of the national Nursing Community.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Consistent and Respectful Verbiage in the System

**Description**: The system shall use consistent Standard English and adopt the nationally recognized terminology of the Nursing Community. This will ensure that the language is clear, understandable, and respectful, thereby upholding the dignity of users and promoting transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Staff members shall be able to complete a set of tasks in a timely manner.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely Task Completion with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a staff member, I want to complete my assigned tasks efficiently with a clear understanding of the processes and expectations, ensuring that my personal worth and professional dignity are respected throughout the workflow.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The response time of general student management tasks shall take no longer than 5 seconds and the response time of schedule generation shall take no longer than 30 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Respectful Response for Student Management and Scheduling

**Description**: As a student, I want the response time of general student management tasks to take no longer than 5 seconds and the response time of schedule generation to take no longer than 30 seconds, so that I can efficiently manage my academic activities and feel respected in my time and efforts.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be available for use between the hours of 8am and 6pm.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Dignified and Transparent Access to System

**Description**: As an ethically conscious developer, I want the system to be available for use between the hours of 8am and 6pm, clearly communicating this availability to all users. This ensures that users know when they can access the system, thus respecting their dignity and providing transparency about system operation hours.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall achieve 95% up time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Transparency and Dignity with 95% Uptime

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to maintain a 95% uptime, thereby ensuring continuous and transparent access to its services, while respecting my dignity by providing consistent and reliable performance.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: system shall be able to handle all of the user requests/usage during business hours.
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Capacity for User Requests During Business Hours

**Description**: As a user, I should be informed transparently about the system's capabilities to handle all requests during business hours, ensuring that I am treated with dignity, especially when the system is facing high demand.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall cater to 10 simultaneous users from 9am to 5pm.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful User Access Management

**Description**: As a system user, I want the system to transparently inform us about peak usage times and access limitations so that all users' access to the system is managed fairly and everyone's dignity is respected. This includes providing clear communication when the system approaches its user capacity during prime hours and offering alternative access solutions or scheduling options to ensure that no user feels neglected or marginalized.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be capable of processing 100% of nursing students and their classes for the next 10 years.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Transparent and Dignified Processing of Nursing Students' Data Over Time

**Description**: As an educational institution, we ensure that the system transparently processes and records 100% of nursing students and their classes accurately for the next 10 years, while respecting the dignity and inherent worth of each student by safeguarding their personal information and providing them with clear communication about data usage and processing.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be expected to manage the nursing program curriculum and class/clinical scheduling for a minimum of 5 years.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Nursing Program Management

**Description**: As a nursing program administrator, I want the system to manage the curriculum and class/clinical scheduling transparently and respectfully for a minimum of 5 years to ensure that all stakeholders, including students and faculty, are well-informed and their dignity is upheld throughout the scheduling process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall able to operate within a business office environment typical of the Nursing Department at DePaul University.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Integration of AI in Nursing Department at DePaul University

**Description**: As a developer, I want the AI system to operate transparently within the Nursing Department at DePaul University, ensuring all users understand its functionalities and limitations. Furthermore, the system should respect the dignity of staff and students by safeguarding their personal data and being easy to comprehend and interact with, promoting a respectful and dignified work environment.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Compliance with Specifications

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the system to operate strictly within the specifications defined by the computers we use, so that we fully understand its capabilities and limitations, and ensure that it respects our professional roles and inherent worth.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall operate within the Windows XP Professional operating system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Compatibility with User Environment 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to operate seamlessly within the Windows XP Professional operating system to ensure that the functionality is fully transparent to me and that my dignity is maintained by respecting my choice of operating environment.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall interface with CampusConnect\92s central server
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Data Handling in CampusConnect Integration

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to interface with CampusConnect's central server transparently, ensuring I am fully informed about how my data is being accessed and used, while respecting my dignity by protecting my personal information and maintaining full compliance with data privacy laws.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall interface with the faculty central server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent and Dignified Faculty Server Interface

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to interface with the faculty central server in a way that transparently communicates the data being transferred and ensures the dignity of all faculty members by protecting sensitive information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall interface with the student master server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Student Data Interface

**Description**: As a student, I want the system to transparently and respectfully interface with the student master server, ensuring that my personal data is securely accessed and used in a way that upholds my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: We must be able to interface with any HTML browser.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Interface Compatibility with HTML Browsers

**Description**: As a user, I want the AI system to be compatible with any HTML browser, ensuring that the information and actions performed by the AI application are transparently communicated and accessible in a way that respects the inherent dignity of all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only authorized users shall have access to clinical site information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to Clinical Site Information

**Description**: As an authorized user, I want access to clinical site information to be restricted to only those with proper authorization to respect patient dignity and ensure that transparency regarding who can access sensitive information is maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members are the only people who shall have access to clinical site details.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Dr Susan Poslusny and Dr Julie Donalek are the only people who shall have access to students\92 personal information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restricted Access to Student Personal Information

**Description**: Only Dr. Susan Poslusny and Dr. Julie Donalek shall have access to students' personal information, ensuring that the handling and accessing of such sensitive data is clearly governed and limited to these designated individuals. This restriction is communicated openly to maintain transparency and safeguard the dignity of students by protecting their personal information from unauthorized access.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to CampusConnect Interface

**Description**: As an authorized user, I should have exclusive access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect, ensuring that my access is clearly documented, communicated, and justified to maintain transparency and respect for my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Fit Criterion: Dr Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol are the only people who shall have access to the final class section scheduling for the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Restricted Access to Final Class Scheduling

**Description**: As a responsible system administrator, I want to ensure that only Dr. Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol have access to the final class section scheduling within the system interfacing with CampusConnect. This will maintain transparency in schedule handling and respect the dignity and privacy of student and faculty data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall use the organization\92s standard virus protection software to help monitor threats to itself.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Implement Standard Virus Protection Software with Transparent Monitoring

**Description**: As a system user, I want the system to use the organization's standard virus protection software to monitor threats transparently, ensuring that all monitoring activities are clearly communicated to me and respect my dignity by not unduly invading my privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.

**Title**: Associate Cohort to Program of Study with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As an education administrator, I need to ensure that each cohort is transparently associated with a specific Program of Study offered by the department, so that students are informed and can make decisions with a full understanding of their educational path. This ensures that all cohorts are treated with dignity by respecting their right to clear and understandable information about their academic program.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Student Cohorts

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I need the ability to transparently and respectfully add a listing of students to a cohort so that students' information is managed with dignity and everyone involved understands the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Assignment of Students to Cohorts 

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently add a student to a cohort in a manner that respects the dignity of each student by ensuring fair and clear communication about the criteria and process used for their assignment.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort\92s Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Eligibility Transparency and Respect for Students Joining Cohorts

**Description**: As a university administration system, it should transparently verify and communicate the eligibility criteria for students joining any cohort's program of study, ensuring their dignity is respected by maintaining clear and consistent standards.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Specify Preferred Sequence of Classes for Cohort with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort in a transparent manner, ensuring that all stakeholders understand the rationale behind the sequence, while respecting the dignity and diverse needs of all students involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each class within a sequence for a cohort  Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Scheduling for Course Offerings

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently specify the quarter that each class within a sequence for a cohort will be offered, ensuring that all stakeholders are clearly informed and the dignity of students is respected by providing accurate scheduling information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Course Management 

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to add new classes to a sequence of classes transparently and with clear guidelines, so that the process respects all stakeholders' dignity. This includes documenting all additions with justifications, ensuring that the information is accessible to relevant parties, and considering the input and wellbeing of both staff and students.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Management of Clinical Classes

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes in a transparent manner and with respect for the dignity of all stakeholders, ensuring that information is openly available and accurately represented so everyone can understand and trust the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new cohort to the system  identified by start month and year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Transparent and Respectful Cohort Addition for Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to be able to add a new cohort to the system, identified by start month and year, while ensuring the transparency of the process and respecting the dignity of all users. This includes clear documentation, easily understandable instructions for the cohort addition feature, and mechanisms to verify that the inputted data is correct and complete without unnecessary complexity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Nursing Department Classes

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently add new classes for the nursing department into the system, ensuring that all additions uphold the dignity of the nursing staff and student participants by clearly outlining the purpose, content, and expectations of each class.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A class shall be either a non-clinical class or a clinical class.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Class Designation with Transparent and Respectful Categorization

**Description**: As a system designer, I want the system to clearly differentiate between non-clinical and clinical classes, using criteria that are transparent and well-documented. This will ensure that all users understand the distinction and feel respected in their interactions with the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A non-clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  and instructor needs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency and Dignity in Course Specification

**Description**: As a course coordinator, I want the non-clinical class specification process to clearly outline the course name, lecture room requirements, and instructor needs. This will ensure that all stakeholders have a transparent understanding of the course logistics, and that the needs and dignity of instructors are respected by providing the necessary resources and appropriate environment for teaching.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  clinical site needs  lecture instructor needs  and clinical lab instructor needs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Clinical Class Specifications

**Description**: As an educational administrator, I want the clinical class specifications to include clear and detailed information about the course name, lecture room requirements, clinical site needs, lecture instructor needs, and clinical lab instructor needs. This will ensure that all stakeholders, including students and instructors, have a transparent understanding of the course setup and that the needs of instructors are fully respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Creation of New Program of Study by Administrators/Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to be able to create a new program of study in a transparent manner, ensuring that all relevant information about the program is readily available to students and staff. This includes clear descriptions, objectives, and requirements to maintain the dignity of education and respect the inherent worth of our students and staff.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Program of Study Outline

**Description**: As an educational institution, we should ensure that the Program of Study includes a clear and comprehensible program name and a detailed listing of all required classes, both clinical and non-clinical. This information must be presented transparently to respect the dignity of all prospective and current students, enabling them to make informed decisions about their educational journey.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Communication of Program Requirements

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study in a transparent manner so that students clearly understand their academic obligations and feel respected in their educational journey.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members\92 planning purposes.
ethical_us:
