**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the system to transparently display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts across all programs so that I can plan effectively, ensuring every student's educational needs are met while respecting their dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered  number of sections needed  number of labs needed  and room types needed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Reporting of Class Requirements

**Description**: As a responsible system, the report generated for the needed classes shall transparently include all necessary information such as classes to be offered, the number of sections needed, the number of labs required, and the room types needed. The report should ensure that this information is easily accessible and understandable to all stakeholders, ensuring that the system respects the dignity of all participants by providing clear and comprehensive insights into the requirements.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict with regards to the time and day that they are offered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Classes Scheduling Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As an educational institution, we ensure that the scheduling of classes for a given cohort does not conflict with regards to the time and day they are offered. This not only promulges transparency in our scheduling process but also respects the dignity of our students by allowing them to fully engage in their academic activities without scheduling conflicts.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of New Clinical Sites by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to transparently add a new clinical site into the system, ensuring that the process respects the dignity of all individuals involved in the clinical site and provides clear, understandable information about the clinical site to all stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site  contact person  and contact information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Clinical Site Information

**Description**: As a user, I want the clinical site information to include, but not be limited to, the name of the site, contact person, and contact information, so that I can easily understand and validate the authenticity of the site while ensuring that my interactions respect my inherent dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Authorized Clinical Lab Section Additions with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently add a new clinical lab section to an existing clinical class in the system, ensuring that the process respects the dignity of all users involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name  the class  instructor  day and time of the lab.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Respectful Listing of Clinical Lab Details

**Description**: As a user, I should be able to see the clinical site name, the class information, the instructor's name, and the day and time of the lab clearly listed in the clinical lab section. This ensures that I understand who will be leading the lab, when and where the lab will take place, and any other pertinent details, respecting my need for clear and accessible information as well as my inherent worth as a participant in the learning process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of Students to Clinical Lab Sections

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section in a transparent manner that respects the dignity of the student, ensuring that all actions and decisions are clear and communicated effectively to the student.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member to remove a student from a clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Removal Process for Students from Clinical Lab Section

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member, I want to ensure that the process of removing a student from a clinical lab section is transparent and respects the dignity of the student, by clearly communicating the reasons for removal and providing appropriate support and documentation throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enabling Transparent and Respectful Student Transfers Between Clinical Lab Sections

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the ability to transparently move a student from one clinical lab section to another corresponding to the same clinical class, ensuring that the process respects the dignity of the student and provides clear communication about the reasons and implications of the transfer.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Cancellation Policy for Clinical Lab Sections

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to be able to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that section. This ensures that the cancellation process is transparent, and students are treated with dignity by preventing disruption to their schedules and academic plans.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of New Nursing Student to the System

**Description**: As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new nursing student to the system in such a way that the student is fully informed about the data being collected and how it will be used, thereby ensuring their dignity is respected and they are comfortably aware of the relevant processes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A staff member shall have the ability to manage the progress of a part time student  which includes modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Part-Time Student Progress

**Description**: 
As a staff member, I want to manage the progress of a part-time student, including modifying their sequence and timeline of classes, in a transparent manner that respects the student's dignity. This involves ensuring that all changes and decisions are clearly communicated to the student, along with the rationale behind them, and that their consent is obtained before any adjustments are made.

**Ethical principles used**: 
1. Transparency
2. Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts  which will include the students enlisted  the Program of study  sequence of classes  cohort progress through the program  and timeline of completion.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Printable Summary for Individual Cohorts

**Description**: As an educational administrator, I want the system to display a printable summary for individual cohorts, which will include the students enlisted, the program of study, sequence of classes, cohort progress through the program, and timeline of completion, so that I can make informed decisions and communicate progress transparently without compromising the dignity of the students.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites  which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter (Clinical site  general information on labs held at that location  dates and times of all labs held there).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Printable Summary of Clinical Site Lab Information

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a printable summary for individual clinical sites, which includes detailed information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter. The summary should include clinical site general information, details about labs held at that location, and the dates and times of all labs. This feature should ensure that the information is presented clearly and transparently, respecting the dignity of all parties involved by maintaining accuracy and providing necessary details without ambiguity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs  which will include (but not be limited to) class name  class number  lab section  listing of students enrolled  instructor  day(s)  time  and location.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Printable Summary with Respect and Clarity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a printable summary for individual clinical labs that includes class name, class number, lab section, listing of students enrolled, instructor, days, time, and location, ensuring that the information is presented transparently and respects the dignity of all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students  which will include (but not be limited to) student name  student ID  admission date  classes  credits  GPA  and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Displays Printable Summary for Individual Nursing Students

**Description**: As part of ensuring transparency and respecting the dignity of students, the system shall enable nursing students to access and print a summary of their personal and academic records. This summary will include, but not be limited to, student name, student ID, admission date, classes taken, credits earned, GPA, and the cohort in which the student is enrolled. This functionality aims to allow students to clearly understand and verify their educational progress and data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Printable Summary of System Log

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a clear, printable summary of the system log so that I can ensure transparency in the system’s operations and respect for human dignity by being able to easily review and understand the activities performed by the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system  including (but not limited to) staff members  students  lecture instructors  clinical lab instructors  and clinical site administrators.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Contact Information

**Description**: As a developer, I need to ensure that the system transparently displays contact information (e-mail and phone number) of all relevant individuals including staff members, students, lecture instructors, clinical lab instructors, and clinical site administrators, while respecting their dignity by obtaining explicit consent and providing clear information about how their data will be used and protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will use the stored e-mail addresses as a primary means of communicating information to affected parties.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Communication Using Stored Email Addresses 

**Description**: As a system user, I want the system to use stored email addresses as a primary means of communicating information to affected parties in a transparent and respectful manner, ensuring that all communications uphold the dignity of the recipients by being clear and respectful.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will notify affected parties for routine communication purposes  including but not limited to informing students of upcoming offered classes (timeline) and what their schedule will be/shall be.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Communication of Class Notifications

**Description**: As an educational institution, we want to notify students of upcoming classes and their schedules in a manner that is transparent and respectful of their dignity. This means providing clear, understandable, and timely information about class timelines and schedules to ensure that students are well-informed and respected as valued members of the academic community.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting clinicals  including but not limited to clinical section capacity changes  and clinical section cancellations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Affected Parties of Clinical Section Changes

**Description**: As a user of the system, I want to be promptly notified when changes occur that affect clinical sections, such as capacity changes or cancellations. This will ensure that I am fully informed and can make necessary arrangements in a timely manner, respecting my dignity and right to transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting classes  including but not limited to class cancellations  class section detail changes  and changes to class offerings for a given quarter.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Notification on Class Changes

**Description**: As an educational institution, I want the system to notify affected parties when changes occur affecting classes, including but not limited to class cancellations, class section detail changes, and changes to class offerings for a given quarter, so that students and faculty are well-informed and can adjust their schedules accordingly.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts  including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort\92s program of study and changes to a given week\92s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparency in Cohort Notifications 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to notify all affected parties promptly whenever there are changes that impact cohorts, including modifications to the program of study sequence and any weekly schedule changes (e.g., lab cancellation due to instructor illness), ensuring that all stakeholders are well-informed and can adjust accordingly.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting specific students  including but not limited to changing a student\92s status from full time to part time and moving a student to a different clinical section.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notification of Affected Parties for Student Status Changes  

**Description**: The system will transparently notify affected parties, including but not limited to academic advisors and counselors, when changes occur affecting specific students, such as transitioning from full-time to part-time status or moving between clinical sections. This ensures that all relevant individuals are informed promptly, upholding the dignity of the students by treating their academic progression with importance and respect.  

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier  program of study  preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Modification of Cohort Information by Authorized Personnel

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I need the ability to modify information related to cohorts, such as cohort identifier, program of study, preferred sequence of classes, and quarters for specific classes, in a transparent manner that respects the dignity of all individuals involved. This includes clearly documenting any changes made, providing justifications for those changes, and ensuring that the privacy and rights of students in the cohort are upheld.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department including the Program of study name  and required classes for that Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Program of Study Information in the Nursing Department

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the ability to modify the information related to a Program of Study, including the Program of Study name and the required classes, in a transparent manner to ensure that all changes are clearly communicated, respecting the dignity of all stakeholders involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site  including the clinical site name  site contact person  contact information  and address.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Modification of Clinical Site Information by Program Administrators/Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site, including the site name, site contact person, contact information, and address, in a transparent manner that respects the dignity of all individuals involved. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section  including the clinical site name the department/section for the lab  the class instructor day and time of lab and contact information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Clinical Lab Section Information

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section, including the clinical site name, the department/section for the lab, the class instructor, day and time of the lab, and contact information, to ensure that all changes are transparently documented and respect the dignity of all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Nursing Student  including student ID  student name phone number e-mail status (full time or part time) and program of study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Modification of Nursing Student Information

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the ability to modify Nursing Student information, including student ID, student name, phone number, email, status (full-time or part-time), and program of study, in a transparent manner with clear documentation and respect for student dignity. This includes providing students with the means to verify and contest any changes made to their data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Interface Adherence to Corporate Standards

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes application to comply with corporate standards for user interface creation, ensuring that all internal and external applications are transparent and respect user dignity. This includes clear and understandable navigation, accessible information, and respectful interactions with all users, regardless of their background.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All screens created as part of the Disputes application must comply with corporate standards for interface creation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Interface Compliance with Corporate Standards

**Description**: As a developer, I want all screens created as part of the Disputes application to comply with corporate standards for interface creation, so that the application is transparent to the users and respects their dignity by providing a consistent and user-friendly experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Respectful Identification of Dispute Case Status

**Description**: As a user, I want the list of dispute cases displayed after a search to be color-coded based on the dispute case status, ensuring that I can easily identify and understand the status of each case without confusion or misinterpretation. This color-coding system should be intuitive and clearly explained to maintain transparency and respect for the dignity of all parties involved in the disputes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Training and Application Usage for Dispute Resolution 

**Description**: As a cardmember and merchant services representative, I want to understand and be trained on the Disputes application clearly and comprehensively within a 2-day course, so that I can use it regularly and effectively while maintaining the dignity and respect of all stakeholders involved. I should be able to access transparent guidelines and resources throughout the training and application usage to ensure ethical handling of disputes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear and Respectful Dispute Case Creation

**Description**: As a cardmember services representative, I want the training course to provide transparent, comprehensive instructions and respect my dignity, so that I can successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 100% of merchant services representatives shall be able to successfully perform a follow up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Effective Follow-Up Actions by Merchant Services Representatives

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that 100% of merchant services representatives can successfully perform a follow-up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing their training course. This will promote transparency in the resolution process and uphold the dignity of both the representatives and the clients involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The maximum wait time for a user navigating from one screen to another within the Disputes application shall be no more than 5 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely Navigation to Uphold User Experience

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I want to navigate from one screen to another within a maximum wait time of 5 seconds, so that my experience is smooth, efficient, and respectful of my time and dignity. Clear communication regarding any delays or technical issues should be provided to maintain transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance in the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Performance and Communication of Disputes Application Usage 

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes application to support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance, and I want transparency on system performance metrics and any potential issues, ensuring that my experience and dignity as a user are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365  with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows.  Monday \96 Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST
ethical_us:
**Title**: Continuous and Transparent Availability of Disputes Application

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I need the application to be available 24x7x365 with clear communication of scheduled maintenance windows (Monday - Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST, Sunday 1:00am to 5:00am EST), so I can trust the service and use it knowing when it will be down for maintenance.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Statement Database. The Statement Database provides the transaction details to the Disputes System. All transaction details must be obtained from the Statement Database
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent and Dignified Data Handling in Dispute Application

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I want the application to transparently interface with the Statement Database to obtain transaction details, ensuring that the process respects my dignity by clearly communicating how and why my data is used.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Integration for Disputes Application

**Description**: As a disputes application developer, I want the application to interface transparently with the Cardmember Information Database such that all cardmember details are obtained seamlessly and clearly, while respecting the inherent dignity of cardmembers by ensuring their data is handled with utmost care and integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent Access and Protection of Merchant Information 

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to interface with the Merchant Information Database in a way that ensures transparency in data acquisition and usage. Additionally, I want to ensure the dignity of merchants by protecting their detailed information and providing clear communication on how their data is being used and accessed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application.  This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Communication in Dispute and Letters Application Interface

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I want the interface with the Letters application to function transparently and respect the dignity of all parties involved. This means that all letter requests sent to the Print Letter Utility application should be clearly documented and explainable. Additionally, the system should handle all personal information in a manner that upholds the inherent worth and rights of individuals, ensuring full visibility of the process to users and stakeholders.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.  This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant\92s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Integration of Disputes Application with Cardmember Posting and Billing System

**Description**: As a cardmember, I want the Disputes application to transparently interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System for requesting adjustments to accounts. This ensures that all adjustment requests are visible, respectful of my rights, and uphold my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Access Level Compliance for Dispute Initiation

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests, so that the application operates transparently and preserves the dignity of all users by respecting their roles and permissions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only users with Update access must be able to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict Dispute Requests to Authorized Users

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only users with Update access can initiate dispute requests, so that the process is transparent and user dignity is protected by only allowing authorized and capable individuals to handle sensitive actions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only authorized users are allowed to logon to the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Authorized User Access to Protect User Dignity 

**Description**: As an authorized user, I want access to the Disputes application to be limited only to authorized individuals so that my personal and sensitive information is protected, ensuring that my dignity is respected and that I have transparency regarding who can access my data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All authorized users  once authenticated must be able to logon to the Disputes System
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Dignified and Transparent Access to the Disputes System

**Description**: As an authorized user who has authenticated successfully, I want to be assured that my access to the Disputes System is transparent and respects my dignity. This ensures that the authentication process is clear, understandable, and treats me with inherent worth throughout my interaction with the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user\92s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Access Change Transparency for Auditing

**Description**: As an auditor, I want the Disputes System to generate a detailed User Report that lists new users added and changes to existing users' access levels, ensuring that all parties involved can understand and verify these changes, thereby upholding individual dignity and maintaining a transparent system. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All additions of new users and modifications to user\92s access shall be recorded on the User Report.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Documenting User Access Changes 

 **Description**: 
As a system administrator, I want all additions of new users and modifications to user access to be recorded on a User Report, so that I can ensure transparency in user management and respect the dignity of users by providing an auditable trail of access changes.

 **Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If a user account is revoked  it can only be re-instantiated by the System Administrator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent and Respectful Account Reinstatement

**Description**: As a user, I want any action on my revoked account, including its potential reinstatement, to be managed transparently and respectfully by the System Administrator. This includes receiving clear communication about why my account was revoked, the criteria and process for reinstatement, and being treated with dignity throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only the System Administrator shall be able to reset a revoked user logon account
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict Logon Account Reset to System Administrator 

**Description**: As the System Administrator, I want the exclusive ability to reset a revoked user logon account to ensure transparency in administrative actions and maintain the dignity of revoked users by preventing unauthorized access or misuse of their accounts.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Access and Manipulation of Business Data in Disputes Application

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I want the system to handle the manipulation and viewing of business data transparently, ensuring that I am fully informed about how data is being processed and used. Additionally, I want the system to ensure that my personal and professional dignity is respected by providing clear, understandable interfaces and avoiding any misuse of data without direct user access to data files or databases.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All updates to data files or database must be initiated from the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Data Update Initiation by Disputes System

**Description**: As a user, I want all updates to data files or databases to be initiated exclusively from the Disputes System to ensure that data modifications are transparent and that my dignity and rights to accurate information are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Merchant Operating Regulations 

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I want the application to conform to the legal requirements as specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations so that I can be assured that the handling and processing of disputes are conducted transparently and respectfully, upholding my dignity throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance of Business Rules with Merchant Operating Regulations 

**Description**: As a disputes system developer, I want all business rules specified in the Disputes System to be in strict compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations, ensuring transparent operations and respecting the dignity of all stakeholders involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z that govern credit card disputes processing.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance with Legal Requirements for Credit Card Disputes

**Description**: The Disputes application must transparently conform to the legal requirements specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z that govern credit card disputes processing. This compliance will ensure that users' rights and dignity are upheld, providing a transparent and fair process for resolving disputes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Disputes System Compliance with Regulation E and Regulation Z 

**Description**: As a regulatory compliance manager, I want all business rules in the Disputes System to adhere to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z to ensure that users are fully informed about their rights and are treated with respect and fairness.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case.  This ensures a complete audit trail if questions arise later on with regard to a particular dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Detailed History of User Actions on Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a system, the Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case, ensuring a comprehensive audit trail. This allows for full transparency and accountability, thereby upholding the dignity of all parties involved by providing clear evidence in case of any future queries.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Record All Actions that Modify Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a system, I will record all actions that modify an existing dispute case in the case history. This ensures that any changes made to the dispute case are transparent and traceable, thereby preserving the dignity of the individuals involved by maintaining an accurate and truthful account of their case.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible and Transparent Dispute System for All Users 

**Description**: As a user, whether internal or external, I want to access the Disputes System with ease and clarity, ensuring that the system is transparent in its operations and respects my dignity throughout the dispute resolution process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Protect User Privacy in Dispute System

**Description**: As a system user, I want the Disputes System to prevent access to any dispute cases that do not belong to my cardholder base, ensuring that sensitive information related to other users is not disclosed and maintaining transparency about access permissions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Dispute Data Entry Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real-time responses. This interface should clearly explain each step of the process and the purpose of collecting each piece of information, ensuring I feel respected and valued throughout the interaction.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Access Control for Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to provide clearly defined and understandable levels of access for initiating and following up on disputes, ensuring that my interactions with the system are transparent and that my dignity is respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Authorized Access Transparency for Disputes System

**Description**: As an authorized user of the Disputes System, I want to have clear and understandable access to view the disputes data, ensuring that my access rights are transparent and my dignity as a user is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Authorized User Update Access with Transparent Practices

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want the system to provide update access capabilities for authorized users only, ensuring that the process is transparent and easy to understand so that all users feel respected and dignified in their interactions with the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Dispute Selection Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want to easily view and select disputable transactions based on their age from a clear and comprehensible interface, enabling me to initiate a dispute (either a ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on a chosen transaction without confusion or difficulty, ensuring my concerns are addressed respectfully and my rights are upheld.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Initiation of a Single Dispute Case for Multiple Transactions from the Same Merchant

**Description**: As a user, I want to have the ability to initiate a single dispute case for multiple transactions that belong to the same merchant, providing clear and understandable instructions throughout the process. This will ensure that my right to challenge potentially erroneous charges is respected and handled with transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request.   As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request.  The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Ticket Retrieval Request Creation

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to allow me to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request by prompting me to enter all required information. The system should clearly explain why each piece of information is needed and how it will be used, ensuring that my dignity and rights are respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests.  The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Ticket Retrieval Requests in Disputes System

**Description**: The Disputes System must allow users to create three distinct types of ticket retrieval requests, including (1) original receipt requests, (2) copy of receipt requests, and (3) portfolio requests (comprehensive documentation such as provided by car rental agencies). Each request must clearly explain what type of documentation the user will receive and ensure that the user's dignity is maintained by respecting their need for accurate and comprehensive information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restriction on Requests for Original Receipts by External Users

**Description**: As an external user of the Disputes System, I need clear communication on why I cannot request original receipts and how my data and rights are protected, to ensure that I understand the system's limitations and my dignity is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Confirmation Notification for Ticket Retrieval Request

**Description**: As a user, I want to receive a confirmation notification upon creating a ticket retrieval request that clearly outlines the details of my request, so that I am fully informed and assured that my request has been registered and respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request.  The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Chargeback Initiation Process

**Description**: As a user, I want to initiate a chargeback request by entering the required information so that my dispute is handled efficiently and transparently. The system will generate a printed chargeback notification to be sent to the merchant, clearly explaining that their account will be charged back if no valid proof is provided for the disputed transaction. This process ensures that both parties are aware of the status and reasons for the chargeback, thereby respecting the dignity of all stakeholders involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Chargeback Request Confirmation with Essential Information

**Description**: As a user, I must receive a confirmation upon creating a chargeback request. This confirmation should provide clear and understandable information about the chargeback request, including the request ID, the summary of the request, the estimated processing time, and any next steps or actions required. This ensures that users are fully informed and can trust that their request has been properly recorded and is being handled with integrity and respect.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevention of Duplicate Dispute Requests

**Description**: As a user, I want the disputes system to accurately prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests so that my time and effort are respected, ensuring clarity and effectiveness in managing my disputes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction.  The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to  according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Dispute Resolution

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want to have a clear and comprehensible list of possible reason codes for any given transaction. The system shall provide this list accurately, derived from the type of transaction and the industry the merchant belongs to, in accordance with the defined business rules. This process should be transparent and respect my dignity by providing clear explanations and ensuring fairness in the dispute resolution process.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Viewing Existing Dispute Cases Transparently and Respectfully 

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want to view existing dispute cases in a clear and understandable manner, ensuring that the information is presented transparently and respects the dignity of all parties involved. This includes easy access to relevant case details while maintaining the confidentiality and respectful presentation of sensitive data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System must provide Search functionality.  The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number  (2) the merchant account number  (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number.  In addition to the above criteria  the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range  the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification)  the case status (open  closed or all) and the dispute reason code.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Search Functionality with Ethical Dimensions in Disputes System

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want the Search functionality to include options to search by dispute case number, merchant account number, cardmember account number, and issuer number. Additionally, the search functionality must allow filtering results by date range, type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification), case status (open, closed, or all), and dispute reason code, ensuring transparency in search results and maintaining the dignity of all involved parties by respecting their data and presenting it accurately and efficiently.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user.  The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list.  For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Dispute Case Listing

**Description**: As a user, I want a list of all dispute cases that meet the entered search criteria to be provided to me. The list must clearly differentiate the type and/or status of each case using color-coding (e.g., yellow for open cases and gray for closed cases) to ensure transparency in case status and respect the dignity of individuals involved by clearly presenting information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Activity History Transparency in Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user, I should be able to view the history of all activities that have occurred on my dispute case, so that I can understand how decisions are made and ensure that my rights are being respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions.  The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Centric Dispute Follow-Up System

**Description**: As a user of the dispute system, I want to have a clear view of, and the capability to follow up on, my dispute case via appropriate follow-up actions. These actions should be filtered based on the case status and my access level so that I can understand my options and proceed with dignity. This ensures I am well-informed and can engage with the process in a respectful and transparent manner.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system.  A detailed history of the actions taken on the case  including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Detailed Action History for Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user, I want the dispute system to record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies a dispute case, ensuring a detailed history of actions taken on the case is maintained. This will include the date and the user who performed each action, enabling transparent and accountable auditing processes. This transparency respects the dignity of all users by acknowledging their contributions and maintaining a clear record of changes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process  a case activity will be generated.  Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notification of Systematic Actions on Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a system, I will generate a case activity for any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a dispute case. Upon the next logon, the user who initiated the dispute case will be notified that a systematic action has occurred, ensuring they remain informed and their involvement is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All letter requests must be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Formatting of Letter Requests

**Description**: As a user, I want all letter requests to be formatted according to the guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system, so that the formatting process is transparent and respects the dignity of the individuals receiving the letters. This ensures that the letter content is clear, understandable, and presented in a respectful manner.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Any disputes cases that have been closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Dispute Case Data

**Description**: As a user of the online disputes database, I want any dispute cases that have been closed for over 6 months to be purged from the system to ensure that my personal data is handled transparently and my dignity is respected by not unnecessarily retaining sensitive information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product must support Internet Explorer 5.5 and above.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compatibility with Older Browsers for Inclusive Access

**Description**: As a user of our product, I want to ensure that the product supports Internet Explorer 5.5 and above so that individuals using older browsers, particularly those in underprivileged or less technologically advanced situations, can access and benefit from the product without being discriminated against.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product must support Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compatibility with Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and Above

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to support Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above, so that I can use it regardless of my browser version and retain transparency by knowing that the software accommodates my browser choice while respecting my dignity by providing equal access to all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall interface with the Choice Parts System.  This provides the feed of recycled parts data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ethical Integration with Choice Parts System for Recycled Parts Data

**Description**: As an ethical engineer, I want our product to interface transparently with the Choice Parts System to provide a clear and understandable feed of recycled parts data, ensuring that the information respects the dignity of all stakeholders involved. This includes openly communicating any relevant details about the source, condition, and legitimacy of the recycled parts to maintain trust and uphold human dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall run on the existing hardware for all environments.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compatibility with Existing Hardware

**Description**: As an organisation, we ensure that our product runs efficiently on existing hardware across all environments, maintaining transparency about its compatibility and respecting users' dignity by not imposing additional hardware costs or requirements.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall adhere to the corporate Architecture guidelines
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Product Adheres to Corporate Architecture Guidelines

**Description**: As a developer, I want the product to strictly follow the corporate architecture guidelines to ensure it is transparent and respects the dignity of all users. This adherence helps make the software easier to understand, audit, and use without violating user rights or creating opacity in its operation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall comply with corporate User Interface Guidelines
ethical_us:
**Title**: Adherence to Corporate User Interface Guidelines for Ethical Compliance

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to comply with corporate User Interface (UI) Guidelines to ensure that the UI is transparent and respects user dignity. Compliance with these guidelines will make the interface clear, easy to understand, and respectful of user preferences and accessibility needs. This helps users trust the product, understand how to use it effectively, and feel respected in their interactions with it.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall comply with corporate color scheme
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ethical Color Scheme Compliance

**Description**: As a designer, I want the product to transparently comply with the corporate color scheme while respecting diverse user perspectives and promoting their dignity. This includes documenting the rationale behind the chosen colors and ensuring accessibility considerations are met to cater to individuals with visual impairments.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The appearance of the product shall appear professional
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Professional and Respectful Appearance of the Product

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to have a professional appearance to promote trust and respect for my inherent dignity. Transparency in design and communication about the product's functionality will contribute to a professional and respectful experience.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The product shall be easy to use by Adjusters and Collision Estimators.  95% of Adjusters and Collision Estimators shall find the product easy to use.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Usability for Adjusters and Collision Estimators

**Description**: As an Adjuster or Collision Estimator, I want the product to be intuitive and user-friendly so that 95% of my peers and I can find it easy to use, thereby respecting our professional dignity and ensuring transparency in how usability features are communicated and implemented.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall increase productivity of Collision Estimators. 80% of the Collision Estimators shall agree their productivity has increase within 1 month of using the product.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Productivity Enhancement for Collision Estimators

**Description**: As a Collision Estimator, I want the product to enhance my productivity transparently while respecting my dignity, so that I can trust its effectiveness and feel valued in my role. To validate this, 80% of Collision Estimators should agree that their productivity has increased within one month of using the product.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Users shall feel satisfied using the product.  85% of all users will be satisfied with the product.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Satisfaction with Ethical Transparency and Respect

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to meet my needs and expectations in a transparent manner, while respecting my dignity, so that I feel satisfied and valued when using it. This includes clear communication about how the product works and how my feedback and concerns are addressed. The goal is for 85% of all users to express satisfaction with the product.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be easy to learn by Adjusters and Collision Estimators.  The product shall be learned with two days onsite training
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ease of Learning and Respect for User Dignity

**Description**: As a product team, we need to ensure that the product is easy to learn by Adjusters and Collision Estimators within two days of onsite training. This will promote transparency in the training process and uphold the dignity of the users by respecting their time and capacity to learn efficiently. Clear and understandable training materials should be provided, allowing users to feel confident and respected throughout the learning process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user shall easily locate instructions while using the product.  User help can be found within 90% of the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Access to Instructions 

**Description**: As a user, I want to easily locate and understand the instructions while using the product, with clear and accessible help available in at least 90% of the system, so that I can efficiently and comfortably use the product without feeling frustrated or disrespected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The search for recycled parts shall take no longer than 15 seconds.  The search results shall be returned in under 15 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Efficient and Transparent Access to Recycled Parts

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to search for recycled parts and return results within 15 seconds, ensuring that the process is transparent and respects my dignity by providing timely and understandable information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The search for the preferred repair facility shall take no longer than 8 seconds.  The preferred repair facility is returned within 8 seconds
ethical_us:
**Title**: Quick and Transparent Repair Facility Search

**Description**: As a user, I should be able to find my preferred repair facility within 8 seconds, with a clear understanding of how the results are generated, so that the process respects my time and provides an equitable opportunity for all facilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: ,'The recycled parts audit report shall be returned to the user within 10 seconds.  The audit report shall be returned within 10 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Timely and Transparent Return of Recycled Parts Audit Report

**Description**: As a user, I want the recycled parts audit report to be returned within 10 seconds to ensure transparency in the audit process and respect for my time and dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved within 5 seconds. The save shall occur within 5 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Data Handling for Repair Facility Ratings

**Description**: As a system user, I want the preferred repair facility ratings to be saved within 5 seconds, ensuring that the saving process is transparent and respectful of user dignity, so that users can trust the system to handle their data efficiently and with respect.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall adhere to the corporate online availability schedule.  The application is brought down only within 98% of the scheduled outages per the availability schedule.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent Adherence to Availability Schedule with Respect to User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to adhere to the corporate online availability schedule, ensuring that the application downtime does not exceed 98% of the scheduled outages. This allows me to plan my interactions with the application accordingly and respects my time and needs, promoting a transparent and dignified user experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure High System Uptime with Transparent Communication and Respect for User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to maintain at least a 98% uptime and experience minimal failures, not exceeding 2% of the available online time. Additionally, I expect the organization to transparently communicate any system downtimes, including the causes and measures taken to resolve the issues, thereby respecting my dignity and trust.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be able to handle up to 1500 simultaneous users. The system shall perform with 1500 users as a time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified User Experience Under High Load

**Description**: As a product owner, I want the system to handle up to 1500 simultaneous users efficiently so that all users experience consistent performance and are informed about any potential limitations or issues, ensuring that the system upholds transparency and respects user dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The average number of recycled parts records per day shall be 50 000.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Reporting of Recycled Parts

**Description**: As a data analyst, I want to ensure that the average number of recycled parts records per day (50,000) is transparently and accurately reported, so that all stakeholders can trust the information and respect is given to the efforts made towards sustainability.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be able to handle 10 000 concurrent users within 2 years of the initial launch.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Dignified and Transparent Handling of Concurrent Users

**Description**: As a product owner, I want the product to transparently handle 10,000 concurrent users within 2 years of the initial launch, ensuring that the system treats all user data with dignity and respect by clearly communicating usage policies and system limitations to users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For estimators  the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Operation of Estimators in Challenging Conditions

**Description**: As an estimator operator in a repair facility, I need the product to function effectively in dirty and noisy environments, ensuring that its operation is transparent and respects my dignity by being reliable and user-friendly even under less-than-ideal conditions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall interface with the ChoiceParts system once per day at approximately 1:00 AM.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified System Interfacing with ChoiceParts

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to interface with the ChoiceParts system once per day at approximately 1:00 AM in a manner that is fully transparent and respects the dignity of all stakeholders. This includes clear communication about what data is being shared, how it is being used, and ensuring that the interfacing process does not compromise the inherent worth or rights of any individual.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The maintenance of the product will fall within the established corporate maintenance windows.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Maintenance Scheduling

**Description**: As a user, I want to be informed about the maintenance schedule of the product within the established corporate maintenance windows so that I can trust the system's reliability and feel respected regarding my usage and time.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be supported using the corporate support center.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Support and Transparency for Corporate Customers

**Description**: As a corporate customer, I want the product to be supported using the corporate support center, ensuring that all support interactions are transparent and my dignity is respected. This means that the support center will clearly communicate the steps being taken to resolve any issues, provide explanations in understandable language, and respect my privacy and personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Product installations and upgrades shall be handled by the middleware technology team within established launch time frames.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Product Installations and Upgrades

**Description**: As a user, I want the middleware technology team to handle product installations and upgrades within established launch time frames in a transparent manner, ensuring that all processes are clearly communicated to me and that my dignity is respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only adjusters can request recycled parts audit reports. No users without an adjuster role shall request recycled parts audits.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enforce Adjuster-Only Access for Recycled Parts Audit Reports

**Description**: As an AI system designer, I want to ensure that only users with an adjuster role are able to request recycled parts audit reports, so that the sensitive information contained in these audits is accessed only by qualified individuals, thereby maintaining transparency and respecting the dignity of all stakeholders involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only adjusters with a supervisor role can update preferred repair facility ratings. Users without the supervisor role cannot access the repair facility ratings.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access to Repair Facility Ratings for Supervisors

**Description**: As a user with a supervisor role, I should have the exclusive ability to update and access preferred repair facility ratings, ensuring that only authorized personnel have this capability. This transparency helps maintain trust and dignity within the organization by ensuring that sensitive actions are only performed by those with proper oversight.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only collision estimators shall search for recycled parts.  Users without the collision estimator role shall not have access to the search for recycled parts.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict Access to Recycled Parts Search to Collision Estimators

**Description**: Ensure that only users with the collision estimator role have access to the search for recycled parts. Users who do not have this role should not be able to perform such searches, maintaining role-specific functions and protecting the integrity of the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only valid data shall be entered into the system. No invalid data shall be entered into the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Validity of Data Entry 

**Description**: As a user, I want to ensure that only valid data is entered into the system so that the integrity of information is maintained, and my work is accurately represented and respected. By implementing measures to prevent invalid data entry, the system will be more transparent and uphold the dignity of users by protecting the accuracy and relevance of their data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance companys claim data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restricted Access to Competitors' Claim Data

**Description**: As an insurance company, I want assurances that I will not be able to view or access another insurance company's claim data, to maintain fair competition and protect the dignity of both companies and their clients.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall free of computer viruses.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Virus-Free Software to Maintain User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I need the product to be free from computer viruses so that my personal data remains secure, and my dignity and trust in the product are upheld. By ensuring complete transparency about the measures taken to prevent and remove viruses, users can feel confident that their privacy is respected and that they are treated with dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall comply with the estimatics laws relating to recycled parts usage.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Eostatics Laws for Recycled Parts Usage

**Description**: As a responsible manufacturer, I want to ensure that our product complies with all relevant Eostatics laws governing the use of recycled parts, providing transparent information about parts sourcing and manufacturing processes, while maintaining the dignity of all stakeholders involved in the supply chain.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall comply with insurance regulations regarding claims processing.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance with Insurance Regulations for Ethical Claims Processing

**Description**: As an ethical product team, we want to ensure that our claims processing system complies with insurance regulations, so that processing is transparent and respects the dignity of all claimants. This compliance will involve clear communication of processes, ensuring claimants understand decisions, and protecting sensitive information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user shall search for the preferred repair facility using vehicle  vehicle location  and radius in miles
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Repair Facility Search

**Description**: As a user, I want to search for a preferred repair facility using my vehicle's location and a specified radius in miles, ensuring that the search process is transparent and respects my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The vehicle data shall include vehicle year make and model
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Use and Transparency of Vehicle Data

**Description**: As a user, I want the collection and usage of my vehicle's data, including year, make, and model, to be transparent, so that I can understand how my data is being used, ensuring that my dignity and personal information are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The vehicle location shall include street address city state and zipcode
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Disclosure of Vehicle Location Data

**Description**: As a user, I want the vehicle location data to include the street address, city, state, and zipcode in a manner that is transparent and respects my dignity. This means providing clear and easily understandable information about how this data is collected, used, and shared, while ensuring that my inherent worth as an individual is respected through ethical data handling practices.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall resolve the zipcode for the street address  city  and state if zipcode is unknown.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Dignified and Transparent Zipcode Resolution

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently resolve the zipcode for a given street address, city, and state when the zipcode is unknown, ensuring that the process respects my dignity and provides clear information on how the zipcode was determined.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Controlled Search Radius with Clear Communication

**Description**: As a user of the search feature, I want to be able to set my own search radius between 1 and 30 miles with transparent information about how the radius is calculated and its implications, ensuring my choices are respected and my dignity preserved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Facility Recommendations

text: System shall allow users to update their billing and contact information via the \93My Account\94 section of the website.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Update of Billing and Contact Information

**Description**: As a user, I want to easily update my billing and contact information in the "My Account" section of the website, so that my personal and financial details are always accurate and up-to-date. The system should inform me clearly about how my information will be used and protected, ensuring my dignity and maintaining transparency around data handling practices.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Pre-paid cards shall be distributed via email or via a printed paper card.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Distribution of Pre-Paid Cards
