**Description**: As a user, I want pre-paid cards to be distributed via email or printed paper card with complete transparency, ensuring that my dignity is respected in the process. Information about the security measures taken for both distribution methods should be clear and easily accessible, allowing me to make an informed choice on how to receive my card without feeling marginalized or exposed to unnecessary risks.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Movies can only be streamed if the customer has purchased a movie  and is within the 2-day time period to stream the movie.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Streaming for Purchased Movies

**Description**: As a streaming service provider, we want to ensure that customers can only stream movies they have purchased within the set 2-day time period while providing clear and accessible information about the purchase and streaming timeframe. This ensures that customers fully understand their streaming rights and their dignity is respected by providing transparent access to their purchased content.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Website must be able to support free trial periods with various parameters set by the Izogn Manager.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Support Transparent and Respectful Free Trial Periods

**Description**: As a website user, I want to be provided with clear and understandable information about the terms and conditions of the free trial periods set by the Izogn Manager, so that I can make informed decisions and have my dignity respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All streaming movie sales will be logged in the database  and accessible by the administrator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Logging and Access of Streaming Movie Sales

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to ensure that all streaming movie sales are transparently logged in the database and made accessible to the administrator, while respecting the dignity and privacy of the users, so that there is clarity and accountability in sales data without compromising user rights.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All registered customer information shall be stored and maintained in the database  even after the customer cancels their account.
ethical_us:
Title: Ethical Handling and Transparency of Customer Data Post-Account Cancellation

Description: As a registered customer, I want to be informed clearly about how my data will be stored and maintained in the database even after I cancel my account, ensuring that my inherent dignity is respected and the data handling process is transparent. This includes providing me with the reasons for retaining my data, the duration it will be kept, and the measures taken to protect my privacy rights.

Ethical principles used: Transparency, Dignity

text: The owner shall have free access to all of the streaming movies.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User's Free Access to Streaming Movies

**Description**: As a platform owner, I want to have free access to all streaming movies so that I can transparently verify the content and ensure that it respects the dignity of all individuals.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Total lead cycle time must be completed in 5 minutes for 90% of lead volume between the business hours of 8AM CST to 8PM CST
ethical_us:
**Title**: Optimized Lead Cycle Time Respecting Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want the lead cycle time to be optimized so that 90% of lead volume is completed within 5 minutes during business hours (8AM CST to 8PM CST). This involves clearly communicating the algorithm's working processes and respecting the dignity of all users by ensuring the system does not unfairly prioritize certain leads over others based on discriminatory criteria.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: No lead evaluation will complete in a time period longer than 25 seconds for 97% of all leads processed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely Lead Evaluation Process

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to evaluate leads within 25 seconds for 97% of all leads processed, so that my experience is efficient and respects my time, while being transparently communicated to me.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The process must fit within the processing time conditions set forth by the Auto Rep Assignment process in which a lead is assigned within 3 minutes of the total life cycle.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely Lead Assignment with Transparent Processing

**Description**: As a user, I want the lead assignment process to comply with the 3-minute processing time condition specified by the Auto Rep Assignment process to ensure my needs are met efficiently. The system should clearly and transparently communicate the status and timing of the lead assignment process, respecting the dignity of users by keeping them informed and ensuring a seamless experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The lead washing process will operate within the established physical web service structure.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Lead Washing Process

**Description**: As a user, I want the lead washing process to operate within the established physical web service structure in a transparent manner, so I can understand how my data is managed and ensure that my dignity is respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The washing process must use a non binding  neutral data format  such as xml  when receiving and processing lead data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Use of Neutral Data Format for Washing Process

**Description**: As a user, I want the washing process to utilize a non-binding, neutral data format like XML when receiving and processing lead data, ensuring that the data handling is transparent and my dignity is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Defect reports will be available to technical units on a 24x7 basis.
ethical_us:
**Title**: 24x7 Access to Defect Reports for Technical Units

**Description**: As a member of a technical unit, I want to have 24x7 access to defect reports so that I can address and resolve issues promptly, ensuring transparency and upholding the dignity of users affected by these defects.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Washing parameters will be updated during scheduled maintenance hours.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Updating of Washing Parameters

**Description**: As a user, I want to receive clear notifications and explanations whenever washing parameters are updated during scheduled maintenance hours, so that I understand the changes and feel respected in the process.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The vendor will verify the invalid lead.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Verifying Invalid Leads with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a vendor, I want to transparently verify invalid leads to ensure that no individual is mistakenly deemed unqualified, and to protect the dignity of all potential leads by respecting their inherent worth and providing clear communication regarding the evaluation process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Vendor will submit a credit validation record to be applied to the enterprise billing system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Credit Validation Submission

**Description**: As a vendor, I want to submit a credit validation record to the enterprise billing system in a transparent manner that respects the dignity of individuals, ensuring clear communication and full disclosure of the data being used and how it will impact the billing process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If a lead is scored to the high range the system will supply the lead data and score to the enterprise system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of High-Scored Lead Data

**Description**: As an ethical developer, I want the system to provide clear and understandable explanations for why a lead is scored in the high range. Additionally, I want to ensure that the lead's data is handled respectfully and with their dignity in mind, ensuring they are informed about how and why their data is being shared with the enterprise system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will validate all leads received by the web service for valid data
ethical_us:
**Title**: Validate Leads with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user of the leads washing functionality, I want the system to transparently validate all leads received by the web service for valid data, ensuring that the validation process respects the dignity and inherent worth of individuals represented by the data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will insert all leads captured by the web service.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Lead Washing Functionality

**Description**: As a developer, I want the leads washing functionality to clearly communicate to users how leads captured by the web service are processed and ensure that any personal data involved respects the inherent worth and privacy of individuals.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the leads score falls within the high average score then it will be process by the ARA functionality.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Handling of High Average Score Leads

**Description**: As an ethical user, I want the ARA functionality to transparently process leads that fall within the high average score range, ensuring that the criteria and process used are clear and respect the dignity of all potential leads.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the leads score falls within the medium average then it will be set for manual verification by an Enrollment Coordinator through the eleads system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Manual Verification for Medium-Score Leads

**Description**: As an Enrollment Coordinator, I want leads with a medium score range to be marked for manual verification through the eLeads system, ensuring that the process is transparent and respects the dignity of potential students by providing human oversight and reducing errors or biases that automated systems might introduce.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the leads score falls within the low average then it will be returned to the supplying vendor
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Lead Scoring and Dignified Handling of Low-Average Leads

**Description**: As a user, I want the AI system to provide a clear and understandable explanation when a lead's score falls within the low-average range, and ensure that the handling of such leads respects the dignity of the individuals associated with them. This involves transparently communicating the reasons behind the score and ensuring that no biased or unfair factors affect the scoring process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will compile both contact and academic scoring information for a total score.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Lead Scoring Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the leads washing functionality to clearly explain how both contact and academic scoring information are compiled to produce a total score, ensuring that all data used respects individual dignity and is presented transparently.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will use the parameters supplied by corporate and schools to score part of the lead.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Lead Scoring

**Description**: As a software developer, I want to ensure that the lead scoring functionality transparently uses the parameters supplied by corporate and schools, allowing users to understand how their leads are being scored and assuring them that the scoring process respects the dignity of all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will return the lead data supplied to the vendor along with the reason of rejection.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Lead Rejection Feedback 

**Description**: As a user, I want the lead washing functionality to return the lead data supplied to the vendor along with the reason for rejection in a clear and understandable manner, ensuring that the process is transparent and respects the dignity of all parties involved. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will have an interface in which lead data parameters can be maintained.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Interface for Lead Data Management 

**Description**: As a user, I want the leads washing functionality to include an interface where I can easily understand, manage, and maintain lead data parameters. This interface should provide clear explanations and justifications for the data being collected and processed to ensure that it respects the dignity of all individuals whose data is being handled. 

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will verify the users authentication and rights to make parameter updates.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Authenticated Access to Leads Washing Functionality

**Description**: As a user, I want the leads washing functionality to verify my authentication and rights to make parameter updates, ensuring that only authorized individuals can modify parameters. This verification process should be transparent, clearly explaining the authentication steps and the criteria for access, thereby upholding user dignity by recognizing their rights and avoiding unauthorized changes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality will store any potential lead duplicates returned by the enterprise system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Potential Lead Duplicates

**Description**: As a system user, I want the leads washing functionality to transparently store and clearly indicate any potential lead duplicates returned by the enterprise system to ensure that individuals' dignity is maintained by preventing misrepresentation and redundancy of data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Prior to submitting the lead to the enterprise system the leads washing functionality will assign the lead to an admissions rep.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Lead Assignment to Admissions Representatives

**Description**: Before submitting a lead to the enterprise system, the lead washing functionality will transparently assign the lead to an admissions rep while respecting the dignity of individuals involved, ensuring that assignments are made fairly and without bias.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The leads washing functionality shall receive a period list of available reps from the enterprise system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Lead Assignment Handling

**Description**: As a system, the process of distributing leads should be transparent, ensuring that each action taken within the lead washing functionality is clearly visible and understandable by the relevant stakeholders. Additionally, this process should respect the dignity of the sales representatives by providing fair and unbiased distribution of leads based on the provided period list from the enterprise system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall simulate the look of ships at sea.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Representation and Transparency in Ship Simulation

**Description**: As a user, I want the ship simulation to clearly indicate whether it is a digitally created representation or a real image, and ensure that the simulated ships respect cultural and historical significance, so that I can trust the content and feel respected during my interaction.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall display the grids within a circle as a view from a periscope.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Periscope View Grid Display

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to clearly display the grids within a circle to simulate a periscope view, ensuring that I can easily understand the grid layout while the design respects my inherent human dignity by providing an intuitive, user-friendly experience.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The product shall display each type of ship in a grid using an image of the specific type of ship.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Ship Types with Clear and Respectful Visual Representation 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to display each type of ship in a grid using an easily understandable and accurately detailed image of the specific type of ship. The images should not use any stereotypes or derogatory symbols and should come with clear descriptive text to respect user dignity and provide transparent information about each ship type.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When the offensive player takes a shot  the product shall simulate the sound of a ship at sea.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Simulating Sound of a Ship at Sea for Offensive Shots

**Description**: When the offensive player takes a shot, the product will transparently communicate the purpose of simulating the sound of a ship at sea, ensuring that it respects the dignity of all players by providing a positive and engaging auditory experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a shot is marked as a miss  the product shall simulate the sound of a shot missing its target.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Respectful Audio Feedback for Missed Shots

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to simulate the sound of a shot missing its target in a clear and respectful manner, ensuring I understand the feedback without feeling demeaned or disrespected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a shot is marked as a hit  the product shall simulate the sound of a shot hitting its target.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Simulation of Hit Sound in Gaming Application

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure the sound simulation of a shot hitting its target is presented transparently and respectfully, so that users are fully informed about the game's mechanics and the simulation does not trivialize violence.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a ship is sunk  the product shall simulate the sound of a sinking ship.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Simulation of Sinking Ship Sound

 **Description**: As a user, I want the product to simulate the sound of a sinking ship in a manner that is informative and respectful, ensuring that users are aware of the context and intention behind the simulation without trivializing real-life tragedies.

 **Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be available 24 hours per day  seven days per week.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Continuous Availability with Transparent Communication

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to be available 24 hours per day, seven days per week, with clear and transparent communication regarding system status and outages. This will help me feel respected and maintain trust in the service.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall able to handle a large number of games simultaneously.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Handling of Multiple Games

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to handle a large number of games simultaneously without compromising on transparency about its capacity and without degrading the experience or dignity of the players involved. This includes clear communication on the system's limits and respectful management of any potential bottlenecks or failures.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game.  The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fast and Transparent Response Times with User-Centric Design

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to ensure that the response time of the game is fast enough to maintain the flow, with 95% of responses occurring within 2 seconds and the remaining 5% within 4 seconds, so that users can trust the performance and experience dignity in the gameplay. This means clearly communicating performance metrics and maintaining consistent responsiveness to enhance overall user satisfaction and trust.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be intuitive and self-explanatory.  Nine out ten users shall be able to successfully complete a game with no training.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Intuitive and Accessible User Experience

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to be intuitive and self-explanatory so that I can successfully complete a game without requiring any prior training. This ensures that nine out of ten users can have a seamless and dignified experience, understanding how to use the product without confusion or frustration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide players no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player
ethical_us:
**Title**: Safeguard Player Identity Information

**Description**: As a player, I want the product to ensure that there is no access to information that might reveal the identity of another player so that everyone's identity remains private and protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The response time shall be fast enough to maintain the flow of the game. The response time shall be no more than 2 seconds for 95% of responses and no more than 4% for the remaining responses.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Transparent Game Responses

**Description**: As a user, I want the game's response time to be fast and transparent, with 95% of responses occurring within 2 seconds, and no more than 4 seconds for the remaining 5%, so that my gaming experience remains fluid and my dignity as a user is respected by providing clear information about response expectations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall maintain a list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Player List

**Description**: As a product manager, I want the product to maintain an accurate and up-to-date list of players transparently, ensuring that players are aware of how their information is being stored and managed. This transparency will uphold the dignity of each player by respecting their inherent worth and rights concerning their personal data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow a user to identify himself or herself as a player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Identification with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want to identify myself as a player in a clear and respectful manner, so that my identity is accurately acknowledged without compromising my dignity or privacy. The system should clearly explain how my information is used and ensure that my self-identification process is respectful and free of bias.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Once a game has been initiated  the product shall make the players assigned to the game unavailable for selection from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Player Unavailability Transparency in Active Games

**Description**: Once a game has been initiated, the product shall transparently display that the players assigned to the game are unavailable for selection from the list of players. This information must be clearly communicated to all users to uphold the dignity of the players involved by respecting their active participation in the current game session.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow a user to remove himself or herself from the list of players at any time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User's Right to Self-Removal from Player List

**Description**: As a user, I want the ability to remove myself from the list of players at any time, so that I have control over my participation and can ensure my personal agency is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall make inactive players unavailable for selection from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency and Dignity in Player Selection

**Description**: As a user of the player selection system, I want inactive players to be visibly marked as unavailable in the selection list, so that it is clear and transparent who can be chosen, ensuring the dignity of players by not misleading users or devaluing inactive players.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Removal of Inactive Players

**Description**: As a player, I want to be transparently informed and respected regarding the product's policy on inactivity, so that if I am removed from the list of players after 24 hours of inactivity, I fully understand the reasons and my dignity is maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Game Initiation with Player Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a player, I want to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players, with a transparent display of each player’s availability status and without any prejudice or bias, thereby respecting each player’s dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display a defensive grid to each player
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Display of Defensive Grid in Initiated Game

**Description**: When a game is initiated, the product shall clearly display a defensive grid to each player, ensuring that players understand how the grid functions and its role in the game. The display mechanism will be explained in simple terms, ensuring all players, regardless of their background or abilities, can understand and engage with the game's strategic elements.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display an offensive grid to each player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Offensive Grid Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As a game platform developer, I want the product to display an offensive grid to each player once a game is initiated in a manner that is clear and easily understandable, ensuring that the interface respects the players' dignity and does not include any offensive or disrespectful symbols or language.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall prevent a player from viewing the offensive or defensive grids of the other player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Play by Restricting Grid Visibility

**Description**: As a player, I want the product to prevent me and my opponent from viewing each other's offensive or defensive grids, ensuring fair play and respect for each other's strategies. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall allow each player to position their 5 ships on their respective defensive grids.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Placement of Ships in Game

**Description**: As a player, I want to understand how to position my 5 ships on my defensive grid clearly and without any confusion, so that I feel respected and valued during the gameplay.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow a player to position ships horizontally on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Equal Access for Placing Ships on Grid

**Description**: As a player, I want clear and transparent instructions on how to position ships horizontally on the grid, so all players have equal understanding and access to this feature, thereby respecting their dignity and enhancing their gaming experience.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships vertically on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Transparent Ship Positioning with Dignity 

**Description**: As a player, I want to position my ships vertically on the grid with a clear and understandable interface, ensuring my choices are respected and reflected accurately, to promote fair gameplay and uphold my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships diagonally on their grid
ethical_us:
**Title**: Allow Diagonal Ship Positioning on Grid

**Description**: As a player, I want the product to clearly inform and allow me to position ships diagonally on my grid, ensuring that the rules and options are transparent and my preferences are respected, thus maintaining my dignity and enhancing gameplay experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall prevent the player from overlapping ships on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Feedback for Ship Placement

**Description**: As a player, I want the game to provide clear and understandable feedback when I attempt to place ships on my grid so that I can easily correct any overlapping placements. This feedback will ensure that I can play the game fairly and with dignity, understanding all actions taken.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When both players have positioned their 5 ships on their defensive grids  the product shall define the status of each player for the first turn.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Turn Initialization for Multiplayer Game

**Description**: As a game developer, I want the system to clearly communicate and explain the process used to define the status of each player at the beginning of the first turn, ensuring that all players understand and agree upon the rules and mechanics, so that players feel respected and their dignity is maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each turn  the product shall identify one player as offensive status and one player as defensive status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Identification of Player Statuses

**Description**: As a player, I want the system to transparently identify and display which player is designated as offensive and which as defensive for each turn, ensuring that this process respects and upholds the dignity of all players involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall maintain the status of each player for a turn  either offensive or defensive.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Player Status Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a player, I want to have a clear understanding of my current status (offensive or defensive) during each turn, so that I can make informed decisions and feel respected and valued by the game system.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: At the start of each turn  the product shall notify each player of his or her status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Player Status Notification

**Description**: As a player, I want to be notified of my status at the start of each turn so that I am fully informed about my current standing in the game. This ensures transparency and respects my dignity by keeping me updated and involved in the gameplay.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each turn  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ethical Choices in Defining Shots

**Description**: As an offensive player, I want to define a shot with clear information on potential impacts and outcomes, ensuring that the shot respects the dignity of all players involved. The system should transparently communicate the mechanics and consequences of each shot to foster informed and ethical decision-making.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each shot  the product shall examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Shot Verification

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently examine and determine whether a shot was a hit or miss on the defensive player's grid so that the process adheres to clear rules and respects the dignity of both players by ensuring fair play.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each shot  the product shall notify the players whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notification of Shot Outcome to Players

**Description**: As a player, I want the product to transparently notify me whether my shot was a hit or miss, ensuring that I am informed with clear and understandable feedback. This process should respect my dignity by acknowledging my actions and providing the necessary information promptly and accurately.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Marking of Shots on Defensive Grid

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to transparently mark each shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player, ensuring the process is clearly explained and understood. This is to ensure that all players are aware of how their actions are being recorded and respected, maintaining their dignity and trust in the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accurate Shot Feedback for Players

**Description**: As an offensive player, I want the system to mark each shot as a hit or miss on my offensive grid, with full transparency on the criteria used and respect for my dignity as a player, so that I understand the game's decision-making process and feel respected in the gaming experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Players Transparently and Respectfully Upon Sinking a Ship  

**Description**: As a player, I want to be promptly and clearly notified when a ship is sunk in the game, ensuring that the communication is respectful and acknowledges the effort involved, so that I can stay informed and appreciated within the gaming environment.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Representation of Sunk Ships

**Description**: As a player, I want the product to clearly mark a ship as sunk on my defensive grid once it has been hit and confirmed to sink, so that I am fully informed of the game status and my opponent's interactions with my fleet are transparently communicated, ensuring a dignified gaming experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall indicate the type of ship sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Indicate Sunk Ship Type Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As a defensive player, I want the system to transparently indicate the type of ship that has been sunk on my defensive grid, while ensuring this information is presented in a way that respects my dignity, so I can clearly understand the current status of the game without feeling diminished or disrespected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
### Title: Ensure Clear Communication of Ship Sinking Event

**Description**: As a product, when a hit results in sinking a ship, the system shall transparently mark the ship as sunken on the offensive grid of the offensive player to promote clarity and respect for the player's understanding of the game's status.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the shot was marked as a hit  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Shot Verification and Definition

**Description**: As a player, I want the system to transparently verify and communicate whether a shot was marked as a hit. Additionally, the system should preserve the dignity of players by allowing the offensive player to fairly define their subsequent shot based on the transparent verification.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the offensive player to defensive
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Status Change for Players

**Description**: As a user of the gameplay system, I want a clear explanation and visible acknowledgement of the rationale behind changing a player's status from offensive to defensive when their shot is marked as a miss, ensuring that the decision-making process is easily understood and respects the player's integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the defensive player to offensive
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clarity and Respect in Player Status Changes

**Description**: As a user of the sports tracking system, I want the system to transparently change the status of the defensive player to offensive when a shot is marked as a miss, with a clear explanation of the reasoning behind this change. This ensures respect for all players involved by providing understandable and transparent rules for status changes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall continue to assign turns until the game is ended.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Turn Assignment Process

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to transparently assign turns until the game ends, while respecting each participant's dignity by ensuring fair and clear turn allocation without bias or confusion.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player\92s ships  which had not been previously marked as sunk.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Game Termination 

**Description**: As a player, I want the game to transparently and fairly end when a hit results in sinking the last of the defensive player's ships, ensuring all actions are clearly communicated and that the outcome respects the dignity of all participants without confusion or ambiguity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Player's Right to End a Game Anytime

**Description**: As a player, I want to be able to end a game at any time during the game, so that I can exercise my right to choose when and how I engage with the game, ensuring that the process is clear and my actions are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a game is ended  the product shall notify the players that the game is ended.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Game End Notification 

**Description**: As a player, I want to be clearly and promptly informed when the game has ended, ensuring that I understand the outcome and the reasons for the game's conclusion, to respect my time and involvement in the game.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The notification of the game ending will include the reason the game is ended (i.e.  a player has won the game or a player has ended the game).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Notification of Game End with Reason

**Description**: As a user, I want the notification of the game ending to include the specific reason (e.g., a player has won the game or a player has ended the game), so that I am fully informed about the outcome and process of the game, ensuring clarity and respect for all participants.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Player Identification Post-Game

**Description**: After the completion of a game, the system shall transparently allow each player to identify themselves as available in the list of players. This process should ensure that each player’s dignity and autonomy are respected, providing clear and understandable options for self-identification without any form of coercion or misrepresentation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to remove himself or herself from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Player Autonomy in Game Exit

**Description**: As a player, I want the ability to remove myself from the list of players at the end of a game so that I can maintain control over my participation and personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be easy to use by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors must be able to accomplish any system task within 2 minutes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ease of Use for Callers and Supervisors

**Description**: As a user (caller or supervisor), I want the system to be easy to use and ensure that I can accomplish any task within 2 minutes, so that I can perform my duties efficiently without frustration or unnecessary delay. The system should also provide clear and understandable instructions, respecting my time and personal dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be easy to learn by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors shall learn how to use the system within 10 minutes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Usability and Clarity for Callers and Supervisors

**Description**: As a user (caller or supervisor), I want the system to be intuitive and easy to learn so that I can understand how to use it effectively within 10 minutes. This will ensure that I can quickly perform my tasks without confusion, maintaining my dignity and respecting my time.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be responsive. At the DePaul TeleServices Center  when a supervisor uses the system to view a callers schedule  the system response time must be no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Responsive User Interaction for Supervisors

**Description**: As a supervisor at the DePaul TeleServices Center, I want the system to display caller schedules with a response time not exceeding 2 seconds for 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds for the remaining time, to ensure I can perform my duties efficiently without undue delay. This level of responsiveness demonstrates the system's transparency and enhances the dignity of supervisors by respecting their time and professional responsibilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: On a 56k connection  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Responsiveness for Enhanced User Dignity on Low Bandwidth Connections

**Description**: As a user with a slow internet connection, I want the system to respond within 6 seconds for 90% of operations, so that I can use the service effectively without feeling marginalized or frustrated, and understand the system's performance.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: On a 112k connection or faster  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 3 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fast and Transparent System Response for 112k Connections

**Description**: As a user with a 112k connection or faster, I want the system to ensure that response times for all operations do not exceed 3 seconds 90% of the time, so that I can trust the system’s performance and feel that my experience is valued.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must be available for use between 7:00AM and 11:59PM all days of the year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Availability to Respect User Dignity and Provide Transparency

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to reliably indicate its availability between 7:00 AM and 11:59 PM every day, so that I am assured of the system's operational times and feel respected regarding my time and expectations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be internet browser independent.The product must run using Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Cross-Browser Compatibility for Enhanced User Dignity and Transparency

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to function seamlessly across various internet browsers, including Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator, so that I can access its features without any hindrances or experience disparity regardless of my browser choice. This ensures the system is transparent in its functionality and respects the dignity of all users by providing equitable access.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Supervisor-Only Access for Advertising Empty Time Slots

**Description**: As a product, I need to ensure that only supervisors have the capability to advertise empty time slots, providing transparent access controls and respecting the dignity of all users by clearly defining and communicating roles and permissions within the system. This prevents confusion and ensures that all users are aware of their access rights and responsibilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller\92s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Access Control for Caller’s Schedule

**Description**: As a product, I must ensure that only supervisors have the ability to access and modify a caller’s schedule to maintain transparency and protect the dignity of the callers. This includes providing supervisors the necessary access to view and advertise empty time slots, with clear audit trails and access logs to ensure all actions are transparent and accountable.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can view schedule of all callers.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Supervisor Access Control and Ethical Management for Call Schedules  

**Description**: As a product manager, I want to ensure that only supervisors can view the schedules of all callers and are allowed to advertise empty time slots, so that the privacy of the callers is respected and transparency is maintained in the allocation of time slots. 

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The interface shall have a simple look. In the interface and usability survey  90% of beta testers must report that the interface is adequately simple.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Simple and Intuitive Interface for All Users

**Description**: As a user, I want the interface to be simple and easy to navigate, so that all users, regardless of their technical proficiency, can utilize the software effectively. In the interface and usability survey, 90% of beta testers must report that the interface is adequately simple, ensuring transparency in user experience and respecting the dignity of all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The interface shall be appealing to callers and supervisors. In the interface and usability survey  80% of beta testers must report that the interface is appealing.
ethical_us:
**Title**:  User-Friendly and Inclusive Interface Design 

**Description**: As a designer, I want to ensure that the user interface is appealing and inclusive to both callers and supervisors, so that it upholds their dignity and is transparently evaluated. The design shall be assessed through an interface and usability survey where at least 80% of beta testers report that the interface is appealing.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall comply with City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework.Application Development Framework will provide structured Graphical User Interface.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Application Development Guide Framework 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to comply with the City of Chicago Application Development Guide Framework, ensuring a structured graphical user interface that is transparent and maintains user dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Monitoring Services

**Description**: As a system, the monitoring services provided will be transparent, ensuring that system administrators and DBAs fully understand the data and insights being generated. This will be achieved through clear and detailed documentation and easy-to-navigate interfaces. Additionally, the interface shall respect the dignity of users by being intuitive and considering their ease of use, requiring no more than two weeks for them to become proficient.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent and Respectful Error Tracking Services

**Description**: As a System Administrator or DBA, I want the product to provide clear and understandable error tracking services that allow me to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time. The service should ensure that all error information is transparently communicated so that I can efficiently identify and rectify issues while ensuring the dignity of all users involved is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Transaction Analysis Portal for System Administrators

**Description**: As a responsible AI, the product shall provide portals that allow System Administrators to analyze transactions through ad-hoc reporting and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), ensuring that all analytical processes are transparent and respect the dignity of all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Asynchronous Messaging.The product shall provide asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce the overhead in communications
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Clear and Respectful Asynchronous Messaging

**Description**: The product shall offer asynchronous messaging capabilities, ensuring that users are clearly informed about how their messages are processed and handled. Additionally, it must treat all users with respect, recognizing their dignity by ensuring that message delivery and processing do not lead to any form of embarrassment or discomfort due to system errors or delays.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Multi-threading and Load Balancing

**Description**: As a development team, we want to implement multi-threading technology and load balancing in a transparent manner, ensuring that users are informed about how their data is processed and managed. This will uphold their dignity by respecting their right to understand the system's operations and ensuring that their data is handled appropriately during high traffic and data load spikes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall process messages within 2 seconds.The product shall have a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Transparent Message Processing 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to process messages within 2 seconds, ensuring that the system's performance is transparent. This will allow users to understand system delays and to ensure that processing meets expected performance standards. Additionally, quick processing times will respect the dignity of users by valuing their time and providing an efficient experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall poll the system for messages every second.The product shall poll the system for new messages at a maximum of every 1 second.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Respectful Notification Polling

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to poll the system for new messages at a maximum interval of every second to ensure that I am promptly notified of important communications, while maintaining clear transparency on how frequently my data is accessed and ensuring my dignity through respectful handling of my information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dynamic Resource Management

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to provide dynamic change support and transparent resource addition, so that I can experience seamless scalability and avoid interruptions of more than one day. This will ensure that I am informed of how resources are managed and feel respected through consistent service delivery.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be robust.The product shall have fault avoidance based on standards adoption.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Product Robustness and Fault Avoidance through Transparency and Standards Adoption

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to be robust and adhere to established standards to ensure fault avoidance, with clear documentation and transparency regarding the standards adopted. This will help ensure that the product respects user dignity by providing reliable and dependable functionality.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be robust with fault tolerance.The product shall have fault tolerance by using recovery technique compensatory transaction and routing around failures.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Robustness and Fault Tolerance through Transparent Recovery Mechanisms

**Description**: As a user of the product, I want to be assured that the system is robust and can handle failures gracefully. This can be achieved by implementing fault tolerance mechanisms such as compensatory transactions and routing around failures. Additionally, it is important that these mechanisms are transparently communicated to me to respect my inherent dignity and to ensure I understand how my interactions with the system are safeguarded against potential failures.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be able to process all transactions.The product shall process minimum of 1 million transactions per year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Transaction Processing 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to process all transactions, including a minimum of 1 million transactions per year, in a transparent manner. This ensures that I fully understand how my transactions are being processed and that my dignity is respected by handling my data responsibly and ethically.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be platform independent.The product shall enable access to any type of development environment and platform.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Platform Independence for Inclusive Accessibility

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to be platform independent and enable access to any development environment or platform so that I can choose the tools and environments that best suit my needs, while understanding the technical functionalities fully and preserving my inherent dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Dignified and Transparent Data Exchange Between CSR and EAM

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to facilitate the exchange of messages between CSR (Customer Service Representative) and EAM (Enterprise Asset Management) in real-time, while ensuring that all data exchanges are transparent and uphold the dignity of all involved parties. This means that all data transferred should be clear, understandable, and respect the privacy and worth of individuals, without creating direct interfaces that may lead to opaque or intrusive practices.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall continue to operate during upgrade  change or new resource addition.The product shall be able to continue to operate with no interruption in service due to new resource additions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Continuous Operation During Upgrades and Resource Additions

**Description**: As a system operator, I want the product to continue to operate seamlessly during upgrades, changes, or new resource additions, thereby ensuring no interruption in service. This maintains transparency by clearly communicating operational reliability and upholds user dignity by preserving the trust and reliance users place in uninterrupted service performance.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall be updated on a regular basis.The product will have a new major feature introduced every six months and quarterly maintenance releases every six months.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular Updates and Transparent Communication

**Description**: To uphold user dignity and maintain transparency, the product shall be updated on a regular basis. Major new features will be introduced every six months, and quarterly maintenance releases will occur every three months. Users will be informed in advance about the specific nature and timeline of these updates to ensure they are aware of changes that may affect their experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall operate with every platform.The product shall accommodate any new technology without any change in its architecture.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Platform-Agnostic Operation with Respect to Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user or stakeholder, I want the product to operate seamlessly across all platforms and accommodate new technologies without necessitating changes in its architecture. This ensures that I have full transparency about the product's operability and supports my dignity by respecting my choices of platforms and technologies without imposing constraints or hidden limitations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall have security.The product shall provide authentication  and authorization.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure Authentication and Authorization

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to have robust security features that include proper authentication and authorization mechanisms, transparently described to me, so my data and interactions are protected, affirming my dignity and privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Audit and Data Storage for Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want the product to have comprehensive audit capabilities and ensure the storage of messages for a minimum of one year. This will enable transparent tracking of transactions and accountability, while upholding the dignity of all individuals involved by respecting their rights during audits.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall use IBM and CCR branding standards. The interface must have one IBM logo and one CCR logo.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Branding Standards in Interface Design

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to adhere to IBM and CCR branding standards, including a clear display of one IBM logo and one CCR logo, so that I can easily identify the authenticity and source of the system, ensuring transparency and maintaining dignity in representation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be displayable on any work computer a CCR user may have. The system interface shall be formatted to display at 800 by 600 pixel resolution.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inclusive and Transparent System Display Requirements

**Description**: As a CCR user, I should be able to access and use the system seamlessly on any work computer, with the interface automatically formatted to a resolution of 800 by 600 pixels. This ensures that all users have equitable access and that the system’s functionality and display are transparent and understandable to everyone, regardless of their workstation configurations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system interface will use CCR nomenclature. The system must use the same nomenclature used in the existing WCS system and reports
ethical_us:
**Title**: Consistent and Transparent Nomenclature Usage

**Description**: As a user, I want the system interface to use CCR nomenclature consistently with the existing WCS system and reports, ensuring that the terminology is clear and understandable to maintain transparency and respect user dignity by preventing confusion and misinterpretation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that\92s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent and Respectful Data Summaries for Management

**Description**: Present data summaries in a clear, understandable, and visually appealing manner for CCR management. Each report type must include at least one high-level summary displayed on the results dashboard/interface, with an emphasis on maintaining the clarity and dignity of the presented data, ensuring that management can rely on the information for informed decision-making.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessible and Understandable User Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to have a point and click interface where all selection and navigation functionality can be activated by either a mouse or keyboard, so that it is accessible and understandable to everyone, including those with disabilities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User-Friendly Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want the interface to be easy to use, so that I can generate reports successfully on my first attempt, ensuring that the design adheres to IBM's usability standards. This fosters transparency in system operations and respects the dignity of users by providing an intuitive and accessible experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Reports must be easy to generate. Reports must be generated within one button click and exported within one button click (after selecting the report)
ethical_us:
**Title**: Seamless and Respectful Report Generation

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to generate and export reports with a single button click to ensure that the process is transparent and respects my time and dignity by minimizing unnecessary complexity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A user shall be able to use the system without instruction after a short amount of time. After one use a user should understand and remember 90% of the system usage and navigation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Intuitive Usability and Accessibility

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to use the system intuitively and efficiently without needing extensive instructions, so that I can quickly understand and remember 90% of the system usage and navigation after a single use, thus preserving my dignity by making me feel competent and respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All CCR users shall receive training before the WCS system is deployed. One training session will be held for 100% of CCR users before system deployment (based on a CCR user being available)
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Comprehensive Training for All CCR Users Before WCS System Deployment

**Description**: All CCR users will receive thorough training prior to the deployment of the WCS system. At least one mandatory training session will be organized to include 100% of available CCR users. This ensures that users understand the system, feel confident in using it, and can perform their duties with dignity and respect.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Appropriate and Transparent Nomenclature and Terminology

**Description**: As a user of the WCS system, I want the system to use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization, and to ensure that all interfaces and reports undergo usability tests by CCR users. This will ensure that the information presented is transparent and respects the dignity of all individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system shall be available at all times as long as IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is accessible. The WCS system will be available 95% of the time IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is available.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Continual Availability of WCS System Aligned with Intranet Uptime

**Description**: As a user of the WCS system, I want the system to be consistently available whenever IBM’s internal intranet W3 is accessible. The WCS system should ensure 95% availability during W3’s operational time to maintain seamless access to services, thereby respecting my need for uninterrupted access and maintaining clear communication about system reliability.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to connect other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent Integration and Dignity in WCS Database Connectivity

**Description**: As a system user, I want the WCS system to transparently connect to other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system. This connection should clearly communicate the data flow and ensure that the dignity of individuals represented within the data is respected throughout the integration process.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure International Data Use Transparency and Respect for Regional Dignity

**Description**: As a user accessing the WCS system from outside the United States, I need transparency around how my data is included and used within the system. Additionally, I want assurance that my regional and cultural dignity is respected, with clear communication on how these considerations are managed by CCR management.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system shall be run in a Windows environment. The WCS shall be accessed by users through the Internet on an IBM computer running a Windows 2000 or above operating system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Access to WCS System

**Description**: As a user, I want the WCS system to be accessible through the Internet on an IBM computer running Windows 2000 or above, ensuring that the system's requirements and operations are clearly communicated and that users' values and worth are respected by using up-to-date technologies that do not compromise their experience or data integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Brio portion of the WCS system must be able to export files in spreadsheet form (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3 formats).  Brio will provide buttons in the user interface that produce/export reports in .xls or .123 file formats.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible and Transparent Export Functionality for WCS System

**Description**: As a user, I want the Brio portion of the WCS system to provide clear and accessible options for exporting files in both Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3 spreadsheet formats. This functionality should be easily discoverable via dedicated buttons in the user interface that clearly indicate the export options for .xls and .123 formats.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system must run queries to the WCS databases once again (on a specified day) to update the available data available to CCR users. Queries must be made to external databases for data refresh once a week.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency and Dignity in Weekly Data Refresh

**Description**: As a CCR user, I want the WCS system to transparently update the data available by querying the WCS databases and external databases once a week on a specified day, so that I am informed about the latest data updates and can trust that my dignity and right to accurate information are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access for CCR System

**Description**: As a CCR employee, I want the system to restrict access only to authorized users, requiring authentication through IBM intranet credentials, so that I can ensure that only credentialed personnel are handling sensitive data and maintain trust in the data management process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The WCS system shall not allow automatic logins by any user. Cookies containing WCS login information about a user will not be stored on a user\92s computer.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Automatic Logins for Enhanced Security

**Description**: As a user, I want the WCS system to prevent automatic logins and not store any confidential login information in cookies on my computer, so that my personal data and access credentials are safeguarded and I can trust the system to handle my information transparently and with respect for my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Each team owner will need to use a username and password in order to be authenticated to reach the team owner\92s page
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Authentication for Team Owners

**Description**: As a team owner, I want to use a username and password to authenticate myself securely, ensuring transparent communication about the data collected and respecting my inherent dignity and privacy throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The Commissioner will be the only authorized user per league to adjust league settings.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Commissioner-Exclusive Authority for Adjusting League Settings

**Description**: As a commissioner, I want to be the only authorized user able to adjust league settings so that the roles and responsibilities are clear to all participants, ensuring fair and respectful management of the league.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Each page shall contain a navigation menu which shows the index into which the current page is contained.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent Navigation and Respect User’s Page Context

**Description**: As a user, I want each page to contain a navigation menu that clearly shows the index and context of the current page, so that I can easily understand my location within the website structure and navigate without confusion, thereby respecting my need for clear information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Consistent Page Layout for Enhanced Usability

**Description**: As a user, I want each page to maintain a similar format with clearly distinguished sections for action items and navigation buttons. This will enhance my ability to easily find and interact with important elements, promoting a more transparent and user-friendly interface.

**Ethical principles used**:
1. **Transparency**: Ensuring a consistent and understandable layout allows users to predict where to find important elements, thereby enhancing the transparency of the system's design.
2. **Dignity**: A consistent and accessible page layout respects the inherent worth of all users by making the system easier to navigate and reducing cognitive load, especially for those who may have disabilities or are less familiar with technology.

text: The message board shall contain the 5 most recently posted messages on the league page. The messages will contain up to the first 150 characters of the message.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Recent Messages with Clarity and Respect

**Description**: As a user, I want the message board on the league page to display the 5 most recently posted messages, ensuring the content shown is clear and respects the dignity of the message authors by including up to the first 150 characters in an unobscured and unaltered manner.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Navigation for New Users

**Description**: As a new user, I want to be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page, so that I am fully informed about the functions and content available to me. This navigation should be intuitive and accessible, respecting my dignity by providing a seamless user experience.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Users shall be able to reach the \91add\92  \91drop\92  and \91trade player\92 pages with one click from the team owner\92s page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Easy Access to Player Management Pages 

**Description**: As a user, I want to reach the "add," "drop," and "trade player" pages with one click from the team owner's page, ensuring that the process is transparent and preserves my dignity. The system should clearly communicate how these actions will affect the team and individual players, providing understandable information and respecting user intentions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Users shall be able to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Display of NFL Player Statistics

**Description**: As a user, I want to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page in a clear and understandable format, so I can easily comprehend the information without misinterpretation and ensure that the display respects the inherent worth and dignity of each player.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application shall ask the user to confirm dropping a player or trading a player before performing the action.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Confirm User Actions for Player Management

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to ask for my confirmation before dropping or trading a player to ensure that I am fully informed and intentional about my actions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application shall be able to complete every user transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Timely and Transparent Transaction Processing

**Description**: As a user, I want my transactions to be processed within one fourth of a second of submitting a request so that I can trust the application to handle my interactions efficiently and with the dignity of a prompt response. The application should also clearly communicate the transaction status at each stage to ensure transparency in the processing.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application shall have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Minimized Application Downtime to Ensure Transparency and User Dignity
