**Description**: As a user, I want the application to have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year so that I can trust in its reliability and have uninterrupted access to services, which respects my time and dignity by ensuring that disruptions are communicated clearly and minimized.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application shall run on a web application server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Web Application Server Operation

**Description**: As a user, I expect the application running on a web application server to operate in a transparent manner, providing clear information and understandable processes about how my data and interactions are managed and ensuring that my dignity is preserved at all times by respecting my inherent worth and rights.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A primary database will be used to store cached data for active users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Storage for User Privacy

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that the primary database used to store cached data for active users is designed and maintained to be transparent and respect the dignity of users. This means clearly communicating how data is stored and used, providing users with accessible information about the data handling process, and implementing robust measures to safeguard user dignity and personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A secondary database will be used to store historical statistics and data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Handling of Historical Data in Secondary Database

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to implement a secondary database for storing historical statistics and data in a transparent manner, ensuring users' dignity is respected. This includes providing clear information on what data is collected, how it is stored, used, and protected, while ensuring that the data usage does not compromise the inherent worth or rights of the individuals whose data is being stored.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Application updates shall occur between 3AM and 6 AM CST on Wednesday morning during the middle of the NFL season.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Application Update Scheduling

**Description**: As a user, I want to be informed about application updates that will occur between 3AM and 6AM CST on Wednesday mornings during the NFL season, to respect my usage patterns and to ensure transparency about downtime.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: New System version releases shall be released at the beginning of each NFL season.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent and Dignified System Releases

**Description**: In order to maintain user trust and respect user dignity, new system version releases shall be communicated clearly to all stakeholders and scheduled at the beginning of each NFL season. This approach ensures that users are well-informed about when to expect updates, and the releases are executed in a manner that considers the users' needs and respects their planning and time.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The RFS system should be available 24/7  especially during the budgeting period. The RFS system shall be available 90% of the time all year  and 98% during the budgeting period. 2% of the time  the system will become available within 1 hour of the time that the situation is reported.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring RFS System Availability and Responsiveness

**Description**: As an organization responsible for the Resource Funding System (RFS), we need to ensure the system maintains a 24/7 availability, especially during crucial budgeting periods. The system should be operational 90% of the time throughout the year and at 98% availability during the budgeting period. For the 2% of the time when the system experiences downtime, it must be back online within one hour of reporting the issue. This commitment upholds the dignity of users by ensuring they have reliable access to resources when needed and maintains transparency by clearly communicating system availability expectations and response times.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum hardware requirements prior to implementation. Minimum Hard Disk Space:  400MB.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent Communication and Respect User Dignity in Hardware Requirements for Workstations

**Description**: As an IT administrator, I want to ensure that 98% of user workstations meet the minimum hardware requirements, specifically a minimum of 400MB hard disk space, prior to implementation. This includes clearly communicating these requirements to all users and respecting their inherent worth by ensuring their workstations meet necessary standards for optimal performance.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0. Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1. Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Workstations Meet Ethical and Software Standards Prior to Implementation

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that 98% of user workstations meet the minimum software requirements (Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1, and Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls) prior to implementation. This ensures transparent communication regarding software standards and upholds the dignity of users by providing them with reliable, industry-standard tools that respect their professional needs and worth.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The RFS system should be able to easily interface with the BDW environment  in order to load the data. \95
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Data Integration Between RFS and BDW Systems

**Description**: As a developer, I want the RFS system to seamlessly interface with the BDW environment to load data, ensuring that the entire integration process is transparent and respects the dignity of individuals whose data is being handled. This means providing clear documentation and explanations of how data is transferred and protected during the integration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Changes to revenue and expense formulae must be applied to the RFS system  every year  prior to the budgeting process start. Revenue and expense formulae will be updated within one week of their receipt  after which 2 weeks will be allotted to testing of the budget calculations  to be conducted jointly by the project development team and PCG Finance.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Revenue and Expense Formula Update Process

**Description**: As a member of the project development team and PCG Finance, I want changes to revenue and expense formulae to be applied to the RFS system every year prior to the budgeting process start, with updates conducted transparently and respectfully. The updates will be completed within one week of receipt, and a transparent two-week period will be allocated for joint testing of the budget calculations. This ensures that all stakeholders are informed and involved throughout the process, respecting their contributions and roles.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW  must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end  will be loaded into the RFS system  prior to the budget start process.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Transparent Data Integration for New Branches and Financial Accounts

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want to ensure that all new branches, complexes, districts, regions, and revenue/expense accounts added to the Business Data Warehouse (BDW) are accurately and transparently reflected in the RFS system. This integration should encompass 100% of the entities available as of October month-end and must be loaded into the RFS system before the budget start process. This will ensure that all financial data is accurately represented, maintaining the dignity and respect of all stakeholders involved by providing clear, transparent, and reliable financial information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system  with the RFS system assigned to their role(s)  shall access the RFS system and use it.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to RFS System

**Description**: As a user of the RFS system, I want to ensure that only authorized individuals can access the system, specifically those who are registered in the UAS system with appropriate RFS role assignments, so that the system usage remains transparent and user dignity is upheld.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: User access should be limited to the permissions granted to their role(s) Each level in the PCG hierarchy will be assigned a role and users will be assigned to these roles. Access to functionality within RFS system is dependent on the privileges/permission assigned to the role..
ethical_us:
### **Title**: Role-based Access Control for User Permissions

### **Description**: 
As a user of the RFS system, I want my access to be limited to the functionalities and data specific to my assigned role. Each level in the PCG hierarchy will have clearly defined roles with specific privileges and permissions, ensuring that I understand the scope of my access and can trust that my personal data and tasks are handled with respect and integrity.

### **Ethical principles used**: 
- Transparency
- Dignity

text: The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance and Maintain User Dignity for Intranet Standards

**Description**: As a product developer, I want to ensure that the product complies with the ENET Securities intranet page standards and requirements to maintain a cohesive and professional user experience. 95% of the product's look and feel will be approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation, ensuring transparency in design decisions and enhancing user dignity. Any remaining 5% of the adjustments will be corrected and approved within one month of product release, ensuring continuous adherence to standards.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The intranet pages should display appropriately in all resolutions  from 800x600 and higher. The display of all the pages will be correct in 95% of the resolutions  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected within a week of notification of the incorrect display.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure High-Quality Display for Intranet Pages Across All Resolutions

**Description**: To maintain user dignity and uphold transparency, our intranet pages must display appropriately in all resolutions from 800x600 and higher. We commit to ensuring that 95% of the pages are correctly displayed prior to implementation. Any remaining discrepancies (up to 5%) will be promptly addressed and corrected within one week of notification, ensuring clear, accurate communication with users about display issues and resolution timelines.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets  within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation  98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User-Friendly Budgeting System with Clear Training

**Description**: As an organization, we want to ensure that users can easily and effectively use our system to complete their budgets within the stipulated time. We will provide one week of comprehensive training before product implementation, ensuring that at least 98% of users can complete their budgets within the required timeframe. This will be achieved through transparent communication of system features and dignified treatment of all users throughout the training process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time  the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User-Friendly and Respectful Interface Response Time

**Description**: As a user, I want the product interface to respond quickly so that I can complete my tasks efficiently, while understanding how the system's performance may vary, in order to feel respected and valued by the service provider.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall operate on Unix and Windows operating systems.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Operates Transparently on Unix and Windows

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to operate on both Unix and Windows operating systems transparently, ensuring that the software's behavior is consistent, clear, and respectful of user dignity, regardless of the OS used.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be evoked by typing “pine” into a command or shell prompt.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified System Invocation

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide clear documentation and communication about the command "pine" required to evoke it, ensuring that all individuals, regardless of their technical background, can understand and use the command with dignity and without confusion. The system must be designed in a way that respects users' abilities and provides support to those who may need it.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall use the SMTP mail protocol.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Use of SMTP Mail Protocol

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to use the SMTP mail protocol in a manner that is transparent about how my emails are sent and received, and respects the dignity of all individuals involved by ensuring their communication is handled securely and with integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send and receive operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Send and Receive Operation

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to support the ability to perform a send and receive operation, ensuring that I am fully informed about how my data is being handled and that my human dignity is respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send only operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Send-Only Operation During Communication

**Description**: As a user, I need the system to support a send-only operation to ensure that my actions and intent are transparent and that my dignity is respected by not requiring unnecessary or intrusive feedback or responses. This operation should be clear in its function and not collect any additional data beyond the intended message sent, fostering a more respectful interaction.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a receive only operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Data Reception 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to support receiving data only operations in a way that is transparent and respects my dignity, so that I can understand how my data is being used and ensure my inherent worth is recognized without misuse.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The system shall use a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide a Clear and Respectful Listing of Available Mail 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to use a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail, ensuring that the information is presented clearly and respectfully, so I am informed and treated with dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall have a help system that offers tips and explanation for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Help System for Enhanced Understanding

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a help feature that offers clear tips and explanations for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand, so I can understand how to use the system effectively without feeling overwhelmed or confused.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow a text search that users may use to find mail messages.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Text Search Implementation for Mail Messages  
**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a transparent text search feature for mail messages so that I can easily locate specific emails, while ensuring that my dignity is upheld by respectfully handling my data.  
**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system search feature should support the use of regular expressions in search.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Search Feature with Regular Expression Support

**Description**: As a user, I want the system search feature to support the use of regular expressions, clearly explaining how to use them, so I can perform precise searches effectively while maintaining my dignity by respecting my need for understanding and clarity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall provide an option to withdraw money.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Option to Withdraw Money with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a clear and transparent option to withdraw money, ensuring that the process respects my dignity by being straightforward and user-friendly, and providing all necessary information about fees, transaction times, and any other relevant details.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall query the user for the amount of money.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Initiated Financial Inquiry

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to clearly explain why it needs to know the amount of money and ensure that the inquiry respects my inherent worth and privacy, so I can trust the system and feel that my dignity is maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall query the user for the account type.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Account Type Query with Transparent Options

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently explain the various account types available and their respective benefits, so I can make an informed decision that respects my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall validate the amount is available in the user’s account before releasing funds to the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Validate User Account Balance Before Releasing Funds

**Description**: As a financial system, I need to transparently validate the amount available in the user’s account before releasing any funds, ensuring the process respects the dignity of the user by providing clear and understandable information on their account status.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall validate the amount is a multiple of $20.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Validation of Transaction Amounts

**Description**: As a user, I need the system to transparently validate that the transaction amount is a multiple of $20, ensuring that I am fully informed about the validation process and my dignity is respected by not subjecting me to unclear or arbitrary rules.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall debit the user’s account upon withdrawal of funds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Fund Withdrawal Process 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide clear and detailed information regarding account debits when I withdraw funds, ensuring that I am fully aware of the transaction details. The system should operate in a manner that respects my inherent dignity by treating my financial data with care and integrity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to issue a specific amount of money to the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Financial Transactions

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently inform me about the specific amount of money being issued, including all associated fees and the process involved, so that I can feel respected and confident in my transactions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system shall be able to select a participant as an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Importance Selection with Explicit Consent

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want to ensure that when I am designated as an important participant in a meeting, I am fully informed and provide my explicit consent for this designation. This ensures that my status is acknowledged with transparency and respects my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system shall cancel a meeting due to canceling of an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Meeting Cancellation

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to clearly communicate when and why a meeting is canceled due to the cancelation of an important participant, ensuring that all affected individuals are promptly informed with respect and dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system shall reschedule a meeting to support conflict resolutions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Meeting Rescheduling 

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to reschedule meetings in a transparent manner, ensuring that all participants are informed about the reasons for the reschedule and that their time and involvement are respected, thereby upholding their dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler shall be accessed from the Web.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Access to Meeting Scheduler via the Web

**Description**: As a user, I want to access the meeting scheduler from the web in such a way that the interface is intuitive and easy to understand, and my personal information is respected and protected. This ensures that I can use the platform transparently and with my dignity intact.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system may (optionally) automatically propose another meeting if current meeting is canceled by an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Auto-Reschedule for Cancelled Meetings

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to transparently inform all participants when an important participant cancels a meeting and automatically propose an alternative meeting time, ensuring that everyone's time and commitment are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system may provide the “meeting initiator” a summary of the scan of “potential meeting participants” showing available “time slots” and schedule conflicts as a means of informing the “meeting initiator” of the overall results of the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Meeting Scheduling Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a meeting initiator, I want the meeting scheduler system to provide a transparent summary of the scan of potential meeting participants, including available time slots and schedule conflicts, so that I can respect the dignity of the participants by being fully informed of their availability and personal constraints.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include an agenda for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Meeting Agenda Inclusion

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want the system to transparently display the proposed agenda for a meeting in advance so that all participants are aware of the topics to be discussed and can prepare accordingly, ensuring their contributions are respected and valued.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system may suggest a “virtual meeting” for available “time slots” if no location is available or feasible for the meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Suggestion Transparency and Dignity in Virtual Meeting Scheduling

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want the system to transparently suggest virtual meetings for available time slots when no physical location is feasible, ensuring that my preferences and dignity are respected during the scheduling process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Include Equipment List in Meeting Scheduler

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to transparently include a list of required equipment for each meeting proposal, so that participants are fully informed and can prepare and participate with dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A meeting scheduler system will temporarily reserve the “time slots” for the proposed meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Meeting Scheduler

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to temporarily reserve the "time slots" for proposed meetings with clear, transparent communication, so that I am fully informed and my time and preferences are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A meeting scheduler system will inform the “potential meeting participant” of the meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Meeting Notification

**Description**: As a potential meeting participant, I want a meeting scheduler system to transparently inform me about upcoming meetings, ensuring that my dignity is respected by providing clear, understandable notifications and sufficient information to make an informed decision about my participation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must be easy to use by both managers and chefs such that they do not need to read an extensive amount of manuals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Intuitive System Interface for Managers and Chefs

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want the system to have an intuitive and user-friendly interface for both managers and chefs, so that they can easily use it without having to read extensive manuals. This ensures that the system is accessible and respects the dignity of all users by valuing their time and expertise.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must be quickly accessible by both managers and chefs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Equal and Understandable Access for Managers and Chefs

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to provide quick and transparent access for both managers and chefs, ensuring that all user roles receive equal and respectful treatment and can easily understand how to navigate and use the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Intuitive Data Display

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships, so that I can easily understand the information presented and make informed decisions without being overwhelmed or confused.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The menus of the system must be easily navigable by the users with buttons that are easy to understand.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly and Transparent Menu Navigation

**Description**: As a user, I want the menus of the system to be easily navigable and the buttons clearly understood so that I can efficiently and independently use the system without confusion or frustration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All the functions of the system must be available to the user every time the system is turned on.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Consistent Access to System Functions

**Description**: As a user, I want all functions of the system to be consistently available every time the system is turned on, so that I can trust the system and feel that my inherent worth and rights are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The calculations performed by the system must comply according to the norms set by the user and should not vary unless explicitly changed by the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User-Controlled and Transparent System Calculations

**Description**: As a user, I want the system calculations to strictly comply with the norms I set and not vary unless I explicitly change them. This ensures I have full understanding and control over the system's behavior, maintaining transparency and respecting my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The client should agree to EULA before using our software.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Client Understanding and Consent for EULA 

**Description**: As a user, I want to receive a clear and comprehensible explanation of the End User License Agreement (EULA) before using the software, so that I can make an informed decision and retain my dignity by understanding the terms and conditions I am agreeing to.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All Web pages generated by the system shall be fully downloadable in no more than 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Web Page Download Speed for All Users 

**Description**: To respect user dignity and promote transparency, our system will ensure that all web pages generated are fully downloadable within 10 seconds, even on a 40KBps modem connection. This allows users with slower internet speeds to access information without discrimination, ensuring a consistent and fair experience for all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Responses to queries shall take no longer than 7 seconds to load onto the screen after the user submits the query.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely Response for Queries 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to load responses to my queries within 7 seconds after submission, to ensure my experience is transparent and respects my dignity by minimizing wait time and frustration.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall display confirmation messages to users within 4 seconds after the user submits information to the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Confirm Submission Transparency for User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want to receive a confirmation message within 4 seconds after submitting information, so I can be assured that my input is acknowledged and respected promptly.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: Users shall be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Login Requirement for Cafeteria Ordering System

**Description**: As a user of the Cafeteria Ordering System, I want to be required to log in for all operations except viewing the menu so that my personal data and order history are protected while still allowing me to easily view the menu without any barriers, ensuring transparency in the system's operation and respect for my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Patrons shall log in according to the restricted computer system access policy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Log-in Process for Patrons

**Description**: As a patron, I want to log in to the computer system according to the restricted access policy, with clear information on why and how my data is being used, so that I feel my personal information is respected and protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall permit only cafeteria staff members who are on the list of authorized Menu Managers to create or edit menus.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Menu Management by Authorized Personnel

**Description**: As a cafeteria staff member, I want only authorized Menu Managers, as listed, to have access to create or edit menus, ensuring that this information is managed responsibly and transparently. This respects the dignity of the position and the trust placed in each staff member, providing clear accountability and maintaining the integrity of the menu management process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Only users who have been authorized for home access to the corporate Intranet may use the COS from non-company locations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized User Access to COS from Non-Company Locations

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only users who have been clearly authorized for home access to the corporate Intranet are able to use the COS from non-company locations. This will be achieved by implementing clear and transparent authentication protocols and communicating these protocols to users, ensuring their dignity and respect in accessing only the environments they are permitted to.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Programmers and application developers will have access to source code to address bugs or system enhancements as deemed necessary. Network Administrator and DBA support is also required to maintain a 24x7 system uptime.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Access and Maintenance of Source Code

**Description**: As a development team, we ensure that programmers, application developers, network administrators, and DBAs have transparent access to the necessary source code and system resources while respecting the dignity and privacy of all stakeholders. This access is granted strictly for the purpose of addressing bugs, implementing system enhancements, and ensuring 24x7 system uptime, with clear documentation and communication channels in place to maintain accountability and transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: System security and access levels are provided in the online system. There are varying levels of system access and functional authority. Each student’s access is limited to his/her own registration records. Only authorized system administrator(s) has access to all student registration records.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Hierarchical Access to Student Registration Records

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to implement secure and hierarchical access levels within the online registration system so that each student's access is limited to their own registration records. Only authorized system administrators should have access to all student registration records. This ensures transparency in access control and upholds the dignity of each student by safeguarding their personal and educational information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The online registration system is “self-service style” system that shall initially address the student registration needs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Self-Service Student Registration with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a student, I want the online registration system to provide clear instructions, explanations, and accessible information so that I can complete my registration process independently and with respect for my personal dignity. The interface will ensure that I understand each step and the implications of the information required.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All data entry forms for the application should match their Microsoft Excel hardcopy counterparts as closely as possible. Hardcopies of these forms were provided to the design team during the second requirements interview.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Data Entry Forms Align with Hardcopy Counterparts

**Description**: As a user, I want all data entry forms in the application to closely match their Microsoft Excel hardcopy counterparts in order to ensure a transparent process and dignified user experience. Hardcopies of these forms were provided to the design team during the second requirements interview.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: 95% of users will not need to read the user manual to be able to use the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Interface for Increased Usability

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to be designed in such a way that I do not need to read a user manual to understand how to use it, ensuring that it is intuitive and accessible for all, including those who may have difficulty with complex instructions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Changes made to the Manage My ID website can be adopted without altering the iOS application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Seamless Integration for Manage My ID

**Description**: As a user, I want any changes made to the Manage My ID website to be integrated without altering the iOS application, ensuring a seamless and transparent service experience that respects my dignity and user independence.

**Ethical principles used**: transparency, dignity

text: The application should be connected to the Internet.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Internet Connectivity

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to transparently inform me when it is connecting to the Internet and explain the purpose of the connection, ensuring that my dignity and personal data are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application should be connected to the GPS device.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Use of GPS Connectivity

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to transparently inform me about its GPS connectivity usage, ensuring that my location data is handled with dignity, and I am given the option to opt-in or opt-out of location tracking at any time. This ensures that the use of GPS respects my inherent worth and provides clear communication about how my data is being used.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application should be easy to extend. The code should be written in a way that it favors implementation of new functions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Code Extensibility for Transparent and Respectful Evolution

**Description**: As a developer, I want the application code to be written in a clear and modular way, so that it is easy to understand and extend. This ensures that any new functionality can be implemented transparently, allowing for respectful and dignified treatment of users' needs and expectations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Test environments should be built for the application to allow testing of the applications different functions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Test Environment for Application Functions

**Description**: As a developer, I want to build test environments for the application to allow for thorough testing of its different functions, ensuring that users understand how the application operates and that their inherent worth and rights are respected during the testing process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application should be portable with iOS and Android.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Application Portability Across iOS and Android Platforms 

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to be portable across iOS and Android platforms so that I can use it consistently and have access to the same features and functionalities, ensuring that my experience and data are respected and transparent across different devices.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall show a tabbed display (or equivalent functionality) with the campus map on one tab and info on the most recently announced building on the other.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible and Transparent Campus Information Display

**Description**: As a campus user, I want the system to provide a clearly organized tabbed display with a campus map on one tab and up-to-date information on the most recently announced building on the other tab. This ensures that I can easily locate and understand key campus changes, respecting my right to clear, accessible information and considering my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall allow the user to scroll the campus map from the campus map tab.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Campus Map Navigation

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to scroll through the campus map from the campus map tab so that I can easily find my way around the campus without any difficulty, ensuring clarity and respect for all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The campus map shall provide visual clues regarding what areas have prepared audio and therefore may be selected.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Inclusive Visual Clues for Campus Map

**Description**: As a user, I want the campus map to provide clear visual clues indicating areas that have prepared audio, enabling me to make informed decisions about navigation and accessibility.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The campus map shall have a pause/resume button. The pause and resume button will allow the user to scroll and select other buildings without being interrupted by the automatic search and announce feature.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Campus Map Pause/Resume Button Enhancement

**Description**: As a user, I want the campus map to have a pause/resume button so that I can freely scroll and select other buildings without being interrupted by the automatic search and announce feature. This feature should clearly inform users about its function and allow them to interact with the map according to their preferences, ensuring that their experience is respectful and dignified.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall provide a way to return to the startup screen.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Return to Startup Screen

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a clear and easy way to return to the startup screen, ensuring that I understand how to navigate the interface and that my actions are respected throughout my interaction with the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It should generate a report about registered complaint to the admin and response report to the user who has submitted his queries.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Generate and Deliver Transparent and Dignified Complaint Response Reports

**Description**: As an administrator, I want the system to generate a clear and understandable report about registered complaints and deliver a response report to the user who has submitted the query. This ensures transparency in the complaint handling process and respects the user's dignity by keeping them informed and valued.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should maintain correct schedules of labs and the documentation of all the lab equipment.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Respectful Management of Laboratory Schedules and Equipment Documentation

**Description**: As a lab manager, I need the system to maintain accurate schedules of lab activities and detailed documentation of all lab equipment. This will ensure that all users have clear visibility of lab availability and equipment status, thereby promoting transparency and respecting the dignity of all lab users by providing them with reliable and accessible information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should use the company colors and logos.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Company Branding Adheres to Ethical Communication Practices

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to use the company colors and logos consistently, ensuring clear and honest communication while respecting the inherent dignity of individuals interacting with the system by preventing any misleading representation.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of failure (e.g. a system crash or power loss).
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Self-Restoration to Maintain Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to be capable of restoring itself to its previous state in the event of a failure (e.g., system crash or power loss), so that my experience and data integrity are preserved, ensuring transparency in system operations and respect for my digital dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall be able to display a menu at all times to facilitate manual order taking should the need arise.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Persistent Menu Display for Manual Order Taking

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display a menu at all times, ensuring I can manually take orders whenever necessary, so that I can maintain transparency in my operations and uphold the dignity of the clients who prefer or require manual ordering processes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall utilise periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Dignified Monitoring of Tablet Operational Status

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want the system to utilize periodic 30-second keep-alive messages between tablets and the server to monitor tablet operational status, so that we can ensure system reliability while maintaining full transparency about the monitoring process and respecting the dignity of users by clearly informing them of the monitoring activities.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as non-operational and disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Timely Flagging of Non-Operational Tablets and Respectful Reassignment of Waiters

**Description**: As a restaurant manager, I want the system to transparently flag tablets that fail to send timely keep-alive messages as non-operational and respectfully disassociate the assigned waiter from the tablet. This will ensure that both the manager and the waiter are informed clearly about tablet statuses and are provided with necessary information and support to maintain efficiency and dignity in their roles.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A waiter password used for tablet login must have a bit-strength of at least 64 bits.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Respectful Access for Waiter Tablets

**Description**: As a restaurant manager, I want the waiter passwords for tablet logins to have a bit-strength of at least 64 bits, so that access to sensitive user data and operational controls is secure. This not only helps in maintaining transparency about security measures but also respects the dignity of employees by safeguarding their professional interactions from unauthorized access.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A waiter password used for tablet login must be changed every three months.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular Password Updates for Waiter Tablet Login

**Description**: As a restaurant manager, I want the waiter's tablet login password to be changed every three months to ensure security and protect personal and sensitive business information. This will help maintain transparency about security practices and uphold the dignity of staff by protecting their access credentials.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A waiter shall only be able to log into one tablet at any given instance of time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Single Device Access for Waiters

**Description**: As a restaurant manager, I want to ensure that waiters can only log into one tablet at any given time so that there is transparency in their actions and to uphold their dignity by preventing potential misuse or errors stemming from multiple device logins.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A waiter that attempts to log into a second tablet while already logged into another tablet shall be rejected and notified through both tablets.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Multiple Concurrent Logins for Waiters

**Description**: As a waiter, I want to be notified and prevented from logging into a second tablet while already logged into another tablet, ensuring transparent and dignified handling of my login sessions.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A display shall not require a user to log in.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Guest Access to Display

**Description**: As a user, I should be able to access the display without needing to log in, so that my personal data and identity remain anonymous when not necessary, ensuring transparency in what data is collected and used while respecting my dignity and autonomy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A surface computer shall not require a user to log in.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Seamless Access to the Surface Computer

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to access the surface computer without needing to log in so that the process is smooth and efficient, while still ensuring that I am informed about how my data is handled and that my intrinsic worth is respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A tablet shall require a user to log in using a username and password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure and Transparent Login Process

**Description**: As a user, I want the tablet to require a login using a username and password, ensuring that the process is transparent and that my personal dignity is respected. Information on how my login data is used and stored should be clearly communicated.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will fully function in major browsers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Cross-Browser Functionality for User Dignity and Transparency

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to fully function in major browsers so that I can access and interact with the system seamlessly, regardless of the browser I choose, ensuring my dignity and right to equal access. Additionally, I want to be able to trust that the system's functionality is consistent and transparent across all major browsers.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system will support mobile users in some way.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Mobile User Empowerment and Respect

**Description**: As a mobile user, I want the system to provide clear information on how my data is used and ensure that my personal dignity is protected. This includes transparent communication about data collection processes and ensuring that my rights and inherent worth are respected throughout my interaction with the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Responses to view information shall take no longer than 5 seconds to appear on the screen.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Swift Data Access for Dignified User Experience

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to respond to my requests by displaying the required information within 5 seconds, so that I experience a dignified and respectful interaction with the application. Additionally, the system's performance metrics and response time data should be transparently communicated to the users, ensuring trust in its reliability and responsiveness.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system shall accommodate large data items without fault.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accommodate Large Data Items Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As an ethical system, it shall transparently inform users of how large data items will be managed, ensuring that the handling of such data respects the inherent dignity of all individuals involved. The process should be fully understandable and communicated clearly to the user.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: System will use secured database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure Database Management 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to use a secured database so that my personal data is protected from unauthorized access and breaches. This security measure will help me to trust the system, knowing my data integrity and confidentiality are maintained.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Unauthorised users can only read data without modifying anything.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Protect Data Integrity for Unauthorized Users
   
**Description**: As an unauthorized user, I should only be able to read data and not modify anything, ensuring transparency in data access permissions and preserving the dignity of the data owners by preventing unauthorized alterations.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: ABS shall handle all expected and unexpected errors in ways that prevent loss in information and long downtime period.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Error Handling Maintains Data Integrity and Minimizes Downtime

**Description**: As a user of the ABS system, I want the system to handle all expected and unexpected errors in a manner that maintains data integrity and minimizes downtime, so that I do not suffer a loss of information or experience extended disruptions in service. This will ensure the system is transparent in its operations and respects my dignity by recognizing the importance of my data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Authenticate and Login user to the web app.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful User Authentication and Login

**Description**: As a user, I want to authenticate and log in to the web app with clear information about how my data will be used and stored, ensuring my dignity and personal rights are respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable new users to register to the tech support system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Registration Process for New Users

**Description**: As a new user, I want to understand clearly how my personal information will be used, stored, and protected during the registration process, so that I feel respected and valued as an individual. The system should provide transparent information about data usage and uphold user dignity by ensuring privacy and respect for personal data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a registered user to change his password if he forgets his password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Password Reset for Registered Users 

**Description**: As a registered user, I want to have a clear and understandable process to change my password if I forget it, ensuring my inherent dignity is respected and I am given complete transparency about each step involved in resetting my password.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a registered user to view his profile. Additional information viz. questions asked by him and answers posted by him are also displayed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Profile Transparency and Respect for Dignity

**Description**: As a registered user, I want to view my profile along with additional information such as the questions I have asked and the answers I have posted, in order to have a clear and transparent understanding of my interactions on the platform and to ensure my profile is presented with respect to my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a user to view questions and their corresponding answers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent Display of Questions and Answers

**Description**: As a user, I want to view questions and their corresponding answers in a way that is clear and easy to understand, ensuring that the information presented respects my intelligence and dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a logged in user to ask questions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable a Logged-in User to Ask Questions with Transparency and Respect for Dignity

**Description**: As a logged-in user, I want to be able to ask questions in a way that ensures I am clearly informed about how my questions and any personal data associated with them will be used, and that my inherent worth and rights are respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a logged in user to post answers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Allow Logged-in Users to Post Answers Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As a logged-in user, I want to be able to post answers to questions, and in doing so, have clear visibility of how my contributions will be used and displayed. The platform should ensure my contributions are handled respectfully, maintaining my personal dignity and ensuring I am fully informed about any moderation or changes made to my posts.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable a logged in user to up vote and down vote answers.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Transparent and Respectful Voting on Answers

**Description**: As a user, I want to up vote and down vote answers transparently, ensuring that my voting actions are clearly visible and rightly influence content quality, while respecting the dignity of content creators by providing feedback in a considerate manner.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Provide an interface for the admin to approve posts so that posts are not visible without admin approval.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Admin Approval Interface for Posts

**Description**: Create a transparent interface for administrators to approve user posts, ensuring that posts are not visible to the public without prior admin approval. This helps maintain a respectful and dignified platform by preventing potentially harmful content from being displayed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Enable the admin to generate reports which contains all the posts and their corresponding replies.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Admin Report Generation with Transparent and Dignified Handling of Posts and Replies

**Description**: As an admin, I want to generate reports that include all posts and corresponding replies so that I can ensure transparent oversight and maintain the dignity of users. The report generation process should be clearly explained, and all collected data must be handled respectfully to protect the inherent worth of the individuals involved.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Information transmission should be securely transmitted to server without any changes in information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Unaltered Information Transmission to the Server

**Description**: As a user, I want my information to be securely transmitted to the server without any changes or alterations, so that I can trust the integrity and confidentiality of my data during the transmission process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Be intuitive even to first time users
ethical_us:
**Title**: Intuitive Interface for First-Time Users

**Description**: As a first-time user, I want the system to be intuitive and easy to navigate, so I can use it effectively without confusion or a steep learning curve. The interface should be designed in a way that respects my cognitive load and provides clear, understandable instructions and feedback.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Flea Market system will interface with the web server and RDBMS software using APIs provided by the implementation language
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical API Integration for Flea Market System

**Description**: As a user of the Flea Market system, I want the system to integrate with the web server and RDBMS software through APIs in a manner that is transparent and respects user dignity. This means that any data exchanges facilitated by these APIs should be clearly documented and communicated to users, ensuring their personal data is handled with respect and care.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All transactions at the Flea Market require a valid user ID and password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency and Respect Dignity in User Authentication

**Description**: As a user of the Flea Market platform, I want to be informed about why a valid user ID and password are required for all transactions, ensuring that my personal information is handled with dignity and respect. This way, I can trust that my data is protected and used fairly.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Secure data transfer over the Internet could be provided using SSL encryption that will be configured by the host system administrator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure and Transparent Data Transfer with SSL Encryption

**Description**: As a user, I want my data to be transferred securely over the Internet using SSL encryption, which will be configured and regularly updated by the host system administrator, to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of my information and respect my dignity. Additionally, I want full transparency regarding the encryption methods and protocols used, including regular updates and clear communication from the host system administrator.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The IP addresses where the transaction was made from will be logged.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Log IP Addresses Transparently and Respect Dignity

**Description**: As a system, I will log the IP addresses where transactions are made transparently, ensuring that users are informed about this practice and understand the reasons behind it. Additionally, measures will be taken to respect the dignity of users by anonymizing the logged data to prevent any misuse or unnecessary exposure of personal information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: User passwords will be stored in the database in an encrypted format.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Encrypted Storage of User Passwords

**Description**: As a user, I want my password to be stored in an encrypted format in the database to ensure that my personal information is protected and secure. This will help uphold my privacy and maintain my trust in the system.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Most of the system functions will be controlled using the administrative interface.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Administrative Interface Control

**Description**: As an administrator, I want the system's functions to be controlled via a transparent administrative interface, allowing me to understand each action and its impact, ensuring that the system operations respect the inherent worth and rights of all users.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Detailed documentation of the code and SRS will enable easy maintenance of the Flea Market.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Detailed Documentation for Flea Market Maintenance

**Description**: As a developer, I want to create detailed documentation of the code and Software Requirements Specification (SRS) for the Flea Market application. This will enable easier maintenance, help new team members understand the system quickly, and ensure that the development process is transparent. Detailed documentation supports the dignity of all team members by valuing their time and effort, making it easier for them to contribute effectively.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Information recorded must include an optional field for context.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Optional Context Field for Recorded Information

**Description**: As a user, I want an optional field for context to be included in the information recorded so that I can provide additional details voluntarily, ensuring that the system transparently captures pertinent information while respecting my dignity by not mandating unnecessary disclosure.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Information should be tagged according to who is entering the data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Information Tagging Based on Data Entry Source

**Description**: As a data management system, I want to tag information according to the person entering the data, so that users can understand the source and authenticity of the information, ensuring transparency and respecting the dignity of data contributors.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must be able to download the most recent medical record.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Download the Most Recent Medical Record Transparently and Respecting Dignity

**Description**: As a patient, I want to be able to transparently download my most recent medical record so that I am fully informed about my health status and my inherent dignity and rights are respected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must store the most recent copy of information in its application data folder.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Current and Transparent Data Storage

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to store the most recent copy of information in its data folder and provide a clear and accessible explanation of what data is being stored, why it is being stored, and how it is being used, to ensure my data is managed with dignity and transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must only update the parts that have changed when connecting to the server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Selective Updates for Enhanced Transparency and User Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to only update the parts that have changed when connecting to the server, so that I can clearly see what is being updated and ensure that my user experience respects my inherent dignity by not overwhelming me with unnecessary changes.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must be able to change and update information on the server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Information Update Mechanism 

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently communicate any changes or updates made to the information on the server so that I can be assured of my data’s integrity and maintain my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The application must log the user out when it is exited.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Logout Upon Application Exit 

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to automatically log me out when I exit, so that I am transparently informed about my session status and my personal dignity and data are respected and protected.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A correct combination of username and password is required for a user to login.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Dignified Login Process

**Description**: As a user, I want a clear and understandable explanation of the login process, including how my data will be used and protected, so that I can trust the system while maintaining my dignity and privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It should give a drill-down view of all data in the medical record after logging in.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Data Access for Medical Records

**Description**: As a healthcare provider, I want to have a drill-down view of all data in the medical record only after securely logging in, to ensure that patient information is accessed transparently while upholding the dignity and respecting the inherent worth of each patient.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user must be able to set an option to hide information based on who has tagged it.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enable Users to Hide Information Based on Tags

**Description**: As a user, I want to have the option to hide information based on who has tagged it, so that I can control the visibility of potentially sensitive or undignified content and make informed decisions about what information I engage with.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The user must be able to add photos from his/her photo library to his/her medical record.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Allow Users to Add Photos to Medical Records Transparently and Respectfully

**Description**: As a user, I want to add photos from my photo library to my medical record in a way that ensures I am fully informed about how my data will be used and guarantees that my inherent dignity and rights are respected throughout the process.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must allow a user to login.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical User Login Experience

**Description**: As a user, I want the login process to be transparent and respect my dignity by clearly explaining how my credentials are used, stored, and protected, ensuring that the data handling processes are easy to understand and designed with respect for my inherent worth and rights.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must allow a user to logout.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Logout Functionality

**Description**: As a user, I want to have a clear and accessible option to log out of the system at any time, so that I can be assured of my privacy and control over my personal data. The logout function should be easy to find and use, reflecting transparency in the design and respect for my dignity by acknowledging my right to end my session securely.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All information must be viewable on the website.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Viewability of All Information on the Website

**Description**: As a user, I want all information to be viewable on the website to ensure clarity and transparency in the information provided. This access will promote trust and respect my dignity by acknowledging my right to be well-informed.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: All information must be updatable on the website.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Updatable Information on the Website for Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a user, I want all information on the website to be updatable so that I can ensure the accuracy and relevance of my personal data, thus promoting transparency and respecting my dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: It must allow a user to download a backup of their medical information.
ethical_us:

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Logout must be automatic after 1 hour of inactivity.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Automatic Logout for User Security and Privacy

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to automatically log me out after 1 hour of inactivity to ensure that my session remains secure and my personal data is protected, without my explicit input. This helps promote transparency by clearly communicating login session practices and respects my dignity by safeguarding my privacy and sensitive information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Full data backups must be created daily.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Daily Full Data Backups to Ensure Transparency and Protect Dignity

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that full data backups are created daily so that any loss of data can be recovered promptly, which maintains transparency in our operations and protects the dignity of individuals by safeguarding their information.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: A user must be logged on to be able to view or edit any medical information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access to Medical Information

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: Each account must securely store all of its data.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should keep the customer contact number.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent Handling of Customer Contact Information

**Description**: As a system user, I want the system to transparently manage and store my contact number, ensuring that I am fully aware of how my information will be used and maintained, while respecting my inherent dignity and privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should keep the customer email.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Preserve Customer Email with Transparency and Dignity

**Description**: As a system user, I want my email to be stored transparently, ensuring that I am fully informed about how and why it is being kept, and treated with respect to my inherent worth and privacy.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should ask the user to key in the pickup date.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Initiated Pickup Date Entry

**Description**: As a system, I will ensure that users are clearly informed about why they are being asked to input their pickup date and how this information will be used, in order to respect their dignity and foster transparency.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Delivery Scheduling for Doughnut Orders

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Location Tracking for Doughnut Delivery

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently store and communicate the exact location where the doughnut will be sent, ensuring that my data is handled with dignity and respect, and I am fully informed about where my data is being used.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The website is available whenever the users want to use it.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure 24/7 Website Availability with Transparent Operations

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system use SSL (secured socket layer) in all transactions that include any confidential customer information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure Transactions Using SSL

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to use SSL (Secure Socket Layer) in all transactions involving confidential customer information so that data is encrypted and secure during transmission, preventing unauthorized access and protecting customer dignity.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system must automatically log out all customers after a period of inactivity.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Automatic Logout for Customer Inactivity

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

text: The system should not leave any cookies on the customer’s computer containing the user’s password.

**Ethical principles used**: Transparency, Dignity

ethical_us:
